name: Iolani Palace
address: 364 S King St, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews:
This place was beautiful.  Talk about royalty!  We had a hilarious and amazing tour guide for this.  He used to work for the District Attorney, so he was telling us stories about how he used to come to this palace to do work here.

The palace is beautiful.  The tour is so interesting and has a lot to show you in such a short amount of time.  They go through every room and show you so many things, it's hard to take it all in that this once was a place where royalty lived.

We did the first tour of the morning and since this place is beautiful at that time.  It's definitely worth checking out.  Make sure to bring a camera or your phone because there's a lot of things you don't normally get to see up close like the jewels and crowns.

The restoration and preservation of the remaining royal collection is phenomenal. I have lived on the island for 20 years and had never thought to tour the palace until family from the mainland visited.  I chose the audio tour for us and was not disappointed. Each room had so much visual history and the audio gave feeling and life in each description and clarification of the history of Hawaii's Royal family.  Each item displayed had so much beauty and the design from the wooden doors to the inlay found on the Mason tools.  There was so much to see and so much I may have missed in my excitement that I am positive that my family and I will return sometime again soon.

I grew in up in  Hawaii but had never visited the palace. 56yo now. Great visit. Marvelous docent. Well restored.  Well worth the time and money on a rainy day. Weather has cleared and headed to the beach next. Mahalo.

Beautiful wood work and excellent job of keeping it as original as possible. Great audio tour. You may want to bring headphones for the audio but they have some available for use. Leave your bags in the car as they want to limit the risk of damage by accident within the palace. The docents were friendly and courteous. A great history lesson for anyone interested in the Hawaiian monarchy.

Great tourist spot or something you should definitely see as a local. Beautiful building with some stipulations no wheelchairs, no scooters, and no strollers. They have wheelchairs to borrow but because of it being historic you are not allowed to use your own. The process for someone who's wheelchair dependent and not self transferring is a pretty big pain but is doable. 

They offer military and Kamaina discounted rates.

name: Diamond Head State Monument
reviews: So incredibly beautiful and the best part was not only the view after the hike but the dole pineapple whip at the bottom in the parking lot. But the views are breathtaking for sure. There were 148 steps near the top I believe that is what we counted. I recommend going early morning or late afternoon because of the heat and take water with you. There are a few view points on the way up where you can rest and see other views. It was just beautiful no matter where we were.

The views were amazing. The hike was not bad at all. There are 142 steps to get to the top, or there is an easier route if you go left after the tunnel. Rocks got a little slick after the rain, but the view was breathtaking. Also at the top we had good timing. It got busy after we were up there a few minutes. Total time up and back was about an hour and half. And I'm average shape I'd say.

It is quite close to Waikiki and you can easily get there by bus for less than $3 US in 2020. There is some steep stairs but most people would be able to reach it and return in 2 hours.  There was a lady who appeared to be in her 60s with a walking stick returning. However on a hot day taking frequent stops is advisable

I loved this place. I had a small bite to eat before going for the hike and rewarded myself with a pineapple smoothie after i left. the soft serve at the place was great. the views were awesome. i don't recommend bringing very small children (or infants in that case) on the hike as there are some steep steps. Great experience overall

Go early as they advised. We got there only at 620 am and already the parking lot was getting full  the diamond package through the visitors center for $20 is a wonderful bargain. At top after you get through tunnel go to the stairs on the right  it's harder but less travelled. The views are magnificent and worth the trip up. If it rains remember to be careful to not slip. Great place

name: Bishop Museum
reviews: The bishop museum is a little pricey especially if your not military but I would say it's worth it. The exhibits that they have are very well put together and nice and informative. They have multiple buildings of exhibits and a planetarium as well! Parking is $5 all day and the grounds are pretty.  Recommend if you have the chance to come and learn more about the history of Hawaii and the other Pacific islands 😁

I'm the type of person who genuinely loves a good museum, to the point where I refuse to view them as 'rainy day activities'. The Bishop Museum has some interesting items but I couldn't help but feel there was a lack of narrative to tie everything together. Many of the items were poorly lit and one of them also had a dead bug in the display case. I was really expecting more for the entry price ($25). Definitely not worth the distance I travelled to get to this place from Waikiki.

This place is amazing! Honestly, everyone needs to go to the bishop house and educate yourself about Hawaiian history. And in fact, you need to go multiple times because there is so much in there and so much to learn. Truly an amazing resource. If you ever have visitors, PLEASE take them here!

Interesting place. An amazing exhibit of the Hawaiian culture. The science center is designed more for kids. There are even activities on the volcano science discovery building, and the planetarium.  Everywhere in the museums tells a story about the traditional Hawaii and Polynesian culture. That was an incredible visit, lots of information and learning.

With the $2 planetarium ticket, it cost about $28 total. It was worth the money; I loved the exhibits and planetarium show. All of the staff were super friendly and knowledgeable with all of my questions. My only negative feedback is that one of buildings clearly labeled on the map as a part of the museum was not open to the public. Even without exploring that building, I spent four hours here so you'll get your money's worth. The gift shop also has some unique, locally made items crafted in old Hawaiian tradition. Definitely much better souvenir or gift that you'll get in a shop at Waikiki.

name: Kapiʻolani Regional Park
reviews:
This place is awesome. 
I had a great walk with my husband while in our vacation. Perfect if you like to go for a run or just to have a nice walk. 
If you are into pics, we will be able to find tons of greats spots. 
Totally worthy

One of my favorite parks where you can go and have a family day or a small gathering with friends. But if you prefer to have it all to yourself for me time. Best part about it, it's just across from the beach. My preference is to walk my fur babies around the park and it is no a small park.

Beautiful place, great for picnicking, alone time, or time with the family.  Great place for exercise.  They have a multitude of work out bars and a beautiful running path. Many extra curricular activities after dark too 🤣🤣🤣🤣🤣

Lots of activities going on here all the time and one of the safest places for teams, leagues to practice and have tournaments in soccer. Best place to have a picnic with big/small grouos, walk, jog, run and jump in the beach after a good workout. If you happen to be there in the late afternoon, also a good place to watch the sunset - or sunrise depending on the time of year!
Wide and spacious. Offers varied opportunities to enjoy; vigorous or relaxing. Beach or grassy, many comfort stations throughout entire park. Parking is also widely available.

name: Fort DeRussy Beach Park
reviews: Best place to watch the sunset in Waikiki! I arrived just as the sun had gone over the horizon dipping into the grand Pacific Ocean!  I've also been during the day and there is plenty of lawn space to sit and just relax. There was also a volleyball game going on, as well as plenty of people exercising or just visiting the park. If you like to people watch, this is a good place. People from all over the world! I like to try and guess where people are from. There are lots of visitors from Australia, NZ, Japan, and the West coast of the US.

Stayed at the hill in the Hawaiian village and this is just right next door to it. Basically past this beach park every day I went for a walk to go venture around Honolulu and Waikiki. This is a beautiful path to walk especially when the sun is about to set.

We watched the fireworks here and it was a perfect spot! We got there about 20 minutes early and had a really nice place to view the fireworks. About 5 minutes before the show the beach filled with people. I would suggest to show up about 15 minutes early.
A beautiful park area located on Waikiki beach with expansive views from Diamond Head to Hilton Hawaiian Village.  This is an ideal location to view the magical Hawaiian sunset.

This place is gorgeous! Great beach for the family! Nice sandy beaches, and gentle waves. Just make sure to check the signs for man o war, as they can congregate here. Their stings will definitely ruin your day!

name: Honolulu Zoo
reviews: This was a great zoo! The safari animal portion of the zoo was the best!!! It wasn't too crowded and we missed the all the school field trips which was perfect!! I really enjoyed the different animals they had. I have been to the biggest and best zoo's but the way this place was set up was fantastic. The staff was so incredibly helpful when. Buying a bottle of water and informing us that we can use the fountain machines to fill the bottle back up if we needed to. One of the smallest zoo's but one of the best at the same time. Great to see local species as well.

We finally visited the Honolulu Zoo after living here for over a year. When we first moved here it was undergoing construction, and still has some underway. 

The zoo is much larger than I expected. Looking at the zoo from the outside it appears small however it is quite spacious once inside. I am a bird fan so I was very thrilled with the aviaries when you first enter the ground. 

Once past the birds you come to the larger animals. Such as the tiger, the elephants and such. The walk around the zoo was very calm and relaxing. the path is in the shade of trees whenever its possible and the nice habitats for the animals are interesting.  My trip to the zoo was near midday so the larger animals had gone for shade to escape the mid-day heat. I will have to go back again to see the exhibits I missed. 

I was so enjoying the Zoo I forgot to take very many pictures, a situation I shall have to remedy on my return trip.

I loved how well taken care of the animals were. My favorite exhibit was going into the bird sanctuary and having them flying around me like they would in the wild. If course the kids loved the large animals like the elephants, tigers, and giraffe. The only thing that could have been better was having water filling stations.

Really nice little zoo. Beautifully landscaped and nice enclosures that offer the animals privacy while still letting us view. Nice few hour stroll to get through everything. Became a member today, we will return!

Great animals... great views... most important-- they treat the animals well.  Really enjoyed feeding time info sessions. Super knowledgeable.  Super loving!  I'd pay way more to support this place...

name: Ala Moana Regional Park
address: 1201 Ala Moana Blvd, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews: Lovely park and beach. Convenient and easy to get to. Lots of activities and seems family friendly. Great vantage point for sunsets and Friday evening fireworks. Wonderful place for outdoor fitness on the water and land. Across the street from major shopping center with pricey and eclectic food court.

One of the best beach on Oahu considering easy access from Waikiki in addition to how beautiful and relaxing it is. 

I love walking from my hotel in Waikiki area to this beach. It's not crowded like Waikiki beach and I like that a lot. So if you wanna just go lay on the beach, relax and get in the water to cool down...on repeat like myself lol, this is the place to go. I see people hanging out there by themselves too so you will probably feel more comfortable doing so if you care.

Water is calm and beach is long so a lot of room for people to hang without getting super close to each other. 

We spotted some turtles poking their heads out too, which is always exciting to see no matter how many times you've seen it!

Love this place (magic island too) 
Been coming here since I was a kid!! The beach is super calm, no waves, they have 2 L&L’s there now, also they put a bathroom & showers on the Magic island side. 
Plenty of Grass on the park side, a work out course with plenty stations, tennis, lawn Bowling, & that’s always been enough for me so I never bothered to look for anything else... 
oh, you can BBQ & have parties there too!!

Great Park with plenty of green space to to kick/throw a football around, depending on your preference. There's a couple of shops on the centre offering food and drinks and there's also great toilet facilities here. The park has great proximity to the beach and the shopping centres where buses run from frequently.

This is the first park/beach I visited when I was in Honolulu and we had a great time. In July the sun sets around 7, so if you go to the beach you should ho around 5. The sunset is incredible and the beach really calm. You can go for a walk in the beach too, as the water isn’t cold, which is great for everyone to get into.

name: Pearl Harbor Tours
reviews: Our driver and guide cousin Shaq was an outstanding  person.  He was so kind and thoughtful to my brother who has a brain tumour. His understanding and patience was truly appreciated.  His knowledge of the places we visited on the island was terrific I recommend him highly.

This amazing company has taken exquisite care of my family and our trips on numerous occasions.  The professionalism and attention to detail, all while treating you like a member of the family - or cousin - is beyond compare.  All of these pictures are shots from our trips with this awesome group!

This Pearl Harbor tour was the best tour we have ever been on. Big shout out to JJ our tour guide. He was amazing and very informative. I would definitely recommend this tour group.  Check them out. You won’t be disappointed.   The Campbell’s 🤙

Today, we went on the tour with our guide Fu’a (Fabian) and what an amazing trip and time!!! This was perfect! Fu’a is the BEST guide! His knowledge of Oahu and Hawaii in general was so appreciated, but also his smile, kindness and willingness to show us everything he could in a day. No regret that we booked with you guys, it’s been memorable!!!

We had so much fun on our first trip that we went back again... and again!!  There's something for everyone.  I loved the adventures like diving with manta rays, snorkeling with dolphins, viewing volcanoes, hiking, swimming, horseback riding and just wondering around the towns we visited.  Others on our trip liked the historical tours like Pearl Harbor and Hulihee Palace.  Then there are the heritage and cultural experiences like Luaus and the Polynesian Cultural Center. There are also the movie set tours (Jurassic Park/World, 50 First Dates, etc).  And of course everyone loves the food!  I'm still dreaming about those pineapple upside-down pancakes.  We got shaved ice every day.  The company arranged most of our activities but we still had plenty of time to relax on the beach.  Our flights were booked, our transportation was arranged, our hotel rooms were booked, and our activity reservations were made.  Everything was included.  The guides are locals and you will feel like a member of their family before you leave.  A hui hou!

name: Koko Crater Railway Trailhead
address: 7604 Koko Head Park Rd #7602, Honolulu, HI 96825, USA
reviews: A tough climb but truly worth it. You have to park in the car park near the baseball field and walk to the start of the railway. From here the gradient of the track gradually increases untill you reach the base of the mountain. From here it goes to easily a 70/75° angle for the majority of the way up. It must be noted that before this point there is an elevated, bridge like, section that runs for about 10 meters with a 5 meter drop below. The sleepers are spaced quite close together here but there is also an easy route to the right for those not keen on going over it. Once at the top the views are amazing in every direction with the sense of accomplishment when you look down at what you've just climbed backing them up. We did the walk when there was a few showers every now and then. This made the sleepers quite slippy so great care was needed on the way down. One of the best walks we've done on the island by far.

Great trail. It’s definitely a hard hike with steep incline up and down. No shade on the trail so it’s best done early in the morning or later in day when it cools down. Two things need to be changed about this trail: 1. Ban speakers from the trail.  No one is interested in listening to your music so please use headphones and be respectful to other hikers. 2. There is shooting range nearby which disrupts the peace and beauty of this trail. Highly suggest timing your hike when the shooting range is closed. Breathtaking views form the top. Enjoy and stay hydrated.

Amazing workout! Loved doing this with my family. Our 3 year old did it halfway up on her own and then my husband carried her. I had my 9 month old on my back. Took us 50 minutes to get up. We spent 30 minutes at the top and carried the kids down, taking only 35 minutes to get down. Don't do it if you have bad knees! So worth it to make it to the top!

Great views for a short hike. Crazy busy hike. We decided to do this as a sunrise hike on a Sunday. We were not the only ones. We got there just after 6am and there were probably 20 other cars there too. Brought headlamps and started climbing. No need for hiking poles but would recommend hiking gloves as I was constantly grabbing the rails to help get up or down. Going at a slow steady pace we only had to stop a few times. I used the "safe way" around the bridge section, my husband did the bridge section. Most the rails were normal step height there were definitely some that were massive. We got to the summit around 645am. There were some locals that knew better and were already going down. Look at the nautical sunrise time if you want to see the sun peak over the horizon. We were up top exploring for almost an hour. Each side of the top has such different view. I believe this trail can continue down to Koko Arch too (but we didn't do that). Took us 45 min to get down at that point there were people coming up too. I can't imagine how busy this hike is during peak tourism season. If you don't have time for a 4 hour hike but want some views this one is a good one. We had a dry sunny day, would not recommend if wet and would recommend early in the day as there is NO shade

Hard hike. You climb ~1000 stairs of all variations. Not maintained, so some areas have a 40 ft drop beneath the stairs. I'm scared of heights so I had to bear crawl my way through that section. The stairs get steeper on the top.

At the end, the reward is panoramic views of the Bay, Waikiki and a lot more of the island. You basically get a 360 view. Apply sunblock, bring water in a light backpack because you may want to use your hands in some areas of the hike.

name: Tantalus Lookout - Puu Ualakaa State Park
reviews: Very beautiful views, rain or shine. Enjoy cruising with my significant other just to hear the rare birds living away from the city.. If you go further up the mountain there’s a beautiful park perfect for photogenic sceneries.

Pretty drive and nice look out
Very pretty drive and a nice view. I don't know if we would go out of way to do this, the weather wasn't great for hiking that day so were looking for something else to do. I feel like the loop too us 15-20 minutes to drive?
Amazing view of the city, diamond head, and ocean. You can even see the airplanes landing at the airport. It's worth the drive up. Not a lot of parking at the top but there were not a lot of people.

Great lookout with 270° views from diamond head, through the city of Honolulu to the airport and west side of the island. From the city it is approximately a 15 minute drive to the carpark of the lookout, which is very small so bare that in mind if arriving by car. The drive down has amazing views of the city and offers a place to stop and take photos. Deffinately worth the drive up.

If you like steep, twisty switchbacks (which I do), to get to great views then this is the place. It gives you a massive area to see from diamond head all the way to Honolulu airport and Pearl Harbor. Get there just when it opens so you can catch the remnants of the sunrise.

name: Honolulu Museum of Art
address: 900 S Beretania St, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews: Went to the Museum during our trip to Hawaii. Our hotel, Alohilani (also fantastic) provides free entry to the museum with room key. My husband and I had a great afternoon exploring the exhibits in the outdoor museum. There was a new exhibit highlighting African American artists, which was being led by one of the museum's educators, which was informative and fun. There is a yummy little cafe and a cute coffee shop in case you need a snack!

Great day to spend time to brush up on your art and artifacts history. To see amazing artwork from different cultures and time period throughout the history of the world. Beautiful place to come to explore history of the arts and dine on delicious food at their cafe. Wonderful for all ages.

A real gem! So much amazing artwork! From early Roman to contemporary and all the good stuff in between!! The docents are knowledgeable and articulate - I learned so much and it just felt like a pleasant conversation. In addition to the art (Western, Asian from East to South and other cultures), the building is gorgeous with lots of little garden nooks. A coffee shop, gift shop and cafe round it all off. The perfect place to spend a rainy day.

I loved the this museum. The open air courtyards are picturesque, each one inspired by a different location. There are many interesting exhibits but the tour of the Doris Duke museum of Islamic art takes the crown. Worth your time.

The museum was great. Ordered Sunday Brunch  at cafe - vegetarian eggs Benedict. Beautiful plate arrived but both the eggs and sauce were not even warm much less hot. Obviously they had been sitting quite a while before being served. So very disappointed. Since I was alone and they didn’t really seem to want to wait on me anyway I just ate them.

name: National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific
reviews: Beautiful memorial to those that lost their lives in battles in the Pacific. This is definitely a must see when your on the island of Oahu. It's about a 15 minute drive out of Honolulu and is free to enter. The grounds are wonderfully looked after and you have the freedom to explore them all you want. It is a drive around cemetery but you can pull up on the right of the road to get out and look around. Worth the visit and doesn't really take that long to look around the place.

We searched and search punchbowl cemetery and finally found a very nice gentleman who directed us to visit our Papa whom we miss dearly.  12 of us came from California and were not going to leave until we visited him.  A big thank you to the nice security guard who personally escorted us to his headstone❣
One of my favorite places to see in Honolulu. The best of you on the island. I love the peace and serenity here. Such a humbling experience being right next to so many great heroes.

The Punchbowl Cemetery affects a person like no ordinary cemetery. The magnitude of sacrifices made to ensure our national sovereignty and therefore our freedoms is on full display here. Headstone after headstone reminds me to appreciate what they had to do on my behalf today. The immaculate grounds are kept up better than any other park on Oahu. That shows how high of respect is shown here. The wall murals depicting major engagements in the Pacific are an education in themselves. The walk up to the Punchbowl overlook is lined with memorials of appreciation. The view of the city and mountains is grand, but also of the size of the National Cemetery.

This is a must do and see when visiting Hawaii.  It has some of the best panoramic views of Waikiki to the Eva plains.  If you can get past the construction cranes ruining the views from all the new developments, it is an amazing view point of picture taking.  At lease Diamond Head is unobstructed for now.

It is very easy to get to via car and right outside of downtown Honolulu as well as only a few miles from Waikiki.  The memorial it's self has an amazing pictorial history of the wars with a focus on WWII.  It is just an amazing construction to pay tribute to those who served during those times.

You don't need much time there, maybe an hour tops depending on how much looking around you want to do.  Once done, it is easy to get back on to what ever other site seeing you are doing.

name: Shangri La Museum of Islamic Art, Culture & Design
reviews: Shangri La Museum is like stepping into a whole different world of Islamic culture and art. Last time I was there was back in March 2003. I traveled with my parents and we met the global international facility as guests. We took the Shangri La Tour with the University of Hawaii Faculty. I simply had a blast and yes you have to dress up nice. The seabreeze was great to cool off.
There are no words to describe how beautiful this plablce is. We really enjoyed our tour and the guide was knowledge and conversational.

If you get the chance, definitely do the Shangri-La tour!!! Really cool experience and a chance to see art dating as far back as 1200 Persia (or something like that). The house is incredible and very inspiring. Plus the views are just amazing! Our tour guide was also very friendly and very knowledgeable about Doris Duke, the art, and the home. Would definitely do this one agian.

PS. I posted several pictures but left some out for you to discover on your own, enjoy 😎🤙

This is another place to add to your visiting list, especially if you're local.  You need to make arrangements through the Honolulu Academy of Arts to see it - don't bother showing up to the site otherwise - but it's well worth the effort.  They have an impressive array of Islamic art and architecture; quite remarkable considering this was a private residence.

I visited Pearl Harbor, I hiked Diamond Head, but I think Shangri La was my favorite thing I did during my time in Honolulu. It's such an amazing place with so much art and gorgeous views. It's hard to imagine anyone ever actually lived there. We also had a great tour guide (wish I could remember her name!) who was very knowledgeable and relaxed with the tour. I recommend this to anyone visiting Honolulu who is even mildly interested in art.

Make a reservation in advance, and note that this is a guided tour that takes 2 hours. The only way to get to Shangri La is on the tour shuttle that leaves from and returns to the Honolulu Museum of Art. In other words, you can't go park at Shangri La and then leave the tour whenever you want. So plan your visit beforehand!

name: Duke Paoa Kahanamoku Statue
reviews: Fantastic statue of Duke Kahanamoku!  The society does great work with keeping the statue well preserved and beautiful, plus there is no shortage of leis adored around Duke’s arms and neck.  It’s a beautiful reminder of Duke Kahanamoku’s legacy and his representation as an ambassador to the island’s strong surfing culture.  An absolutely wonderful must see location.

A trip to Waikiki isn't complete without checking out and getting pictures of the Duke statue! There are always tourists surrounding it so that's a sure sign it's a must-see attraction. I love how leis are around the statue's neck. With the palm trees and glistening water of Waikiki Beach in the background of the statue, it's really a picturesque part of Waikiki.
Stayed in hotel across the road. Very popular statue for tourists. Cool cultural aspect to the beach.

A trip to Waikiki Beach isn’t complete without stopping by the Duke Paoa Kahanamoku SHRINE without paying homage to the GOD of surfing. 

This man surfed his way to FIVE Olympic medals, mastering his craft on a board that weighed 114 pounds. 

Locals and visitors stop by daily to adorn his outstretched arms with leis to pay homage to a master of his craft.

Time it just right, and you can enjoy a world famous Waikiki sunset on the iconic Kalākaua Street. 

ALOHA!

Nice statue that gets lots of attention. People constantly taking pics and placing lej on it. Can be tough to snap a nice angle. 

Homeless people wandering around the area screaming random obscenities also adds a nice touch.

name: Lyon Arboretum
reviews: Lyon Arboretum offers a pretty fun and easy way to see a lot of Hawaiian animals and plants (native and invasive alike). I especially enjoyed getting to see the myriad birds that frequent the park. Definitely take the time to hike up the waterfall trail and explore the side trails, though you'll want to try and shoot for dry weather when doing so. Overall, it's a great place to hike for a few hours.

Very beautiful and peaceful 1 mile hike inside the rainforest. The hike ends with a small waterfall. Make sure you have bug spray on before attempt to hike. Also it can be muddy so hiking shoes would make it more enjoyable. It’s free and less crowded in the morning.

This place is beautiful. I just wish there were slightly more trail marks in the more remote areas. Be prepared for mud and mosquitoes in the side trails, but you can avoid them if you stick to the major paths. There is enough variety in the different garden areas to make several days of exploring.

Beautiful place! Well maintained trails, but slick when raining. The poncho at the gift shop was very useful since we had a downpour. The falls at the end of the hike were gorgeous, especially since it had been raining.

Such a wonderful experience again at the Lyon Arboretum,  we loved it! 
It was second time for us with my husband and we're another path then before,  breathtaking views and some steep hiking as well!
Nature is beautiful and the vegetation/flowers are amazing!
Highly recommended to all ages who loves Nature!
Manoa Falls Trail was very busy today,  but not too muddy,  so we could do it easily.......
Aloha🤙
Pearl and Peter

name: Ho’omaluhia Botanical Garden
reviews: A nice, calm place to spend an afternoon! It's very well maintained. There's a paved walkway with labeled plants and a dirt/rock path that leads to the lake. The lake is man-made but it's fun with ducks and plenty of fish, all sizes. They're all hungry if you want to feed them. Bring a blanket because there's a large grassy area to settle down at. We visited later in the day so parking wasn't difficult, but they have more than one lot. It's free!

The plants are beautiful.  The area is beautiful.  The constant feeling of being policed and the not-so-subtle racism is not beautiful at all.  Basically, if you are Hawaiian you will be treated like you are trying to steal something, or might practice your actual legal gathering rights (gasp) in the wild areas.   Unless, of course, you are a known hula practitioner who has done all the formal hoops of working for them for free while agreeing to their extremely colonial restrictions.  
That being said, it is a beautiful place with lots of cool stuff.   Meeting rooms are useful places for meetings (I mean, you expect bureaucracy there, right?), as are the picnic tables. Nice bathrooms, peaceful feeling when it is not being interrupted by employees with nothing better to do than drive around in their little carts and constantly assert wannabe cop authority, or just give the impression that they might.   
For local settlers: the apparent uniform here consists of walking shoes with socks, khaki shorts, and a hat, preferably with a store-bought walking stick and an assertive stride.   Heed this dress code, or they might mistake you for one of those damn natives.   
And you don’t want that.

Beautiful and peaceful. And great place to walk after gates close around 4pm. 
Just wish they didn't add the ugly cones and signs along the road near the entrance. Seems like a dramatic overreaction to folks who take photos. I think there are other ways to address the issue without ruining the ambiance for others.

This was such a beautiful outdoor experience for my husband, 2 kids and I. Free entrance, parking, and fishing. Bamboo poles can be borrowed for free! Clean bathrooms and grounds. Very picturesque, nice, easy walks. Very friendly and informative staff. Park in the designated stalls only, and don’t be foolish and try to take a picture in the middle of the road where it’s clearly marked not to. Bring food, water, sunscreen, hat. There are water refill stations at the visitor center. We’ll be back.

Nice place to have a look around if your in the area. Entry is free and from the front gate it's about a mile to the visitor centre. From here you can go down to the lake and look around the galleries. You can also drive around the gardens to the dedicated sections from around the world, however you will not see the lake this way. There's also a look out that you can park and walk up to that overlooks the gardens. The park has the mountains to the back of it which provides an amazing backdrop to photos taken here.

name: Kahanamoku Beach
reviews: Beautiful beach located next to the Hilton Village. Nice place to relax during the day with plenty of rocks and coral in the ocean to look at. This is also a nice place to catch the sun set and on a clear day you can watch it dip beyond the horizon. It is also a good spot to catch the Hilton fireworks on Friday nights starting at around 7:30/7:45. There's showers and public facilities along the promenade.

Nice beach — sand is a bit coarse in places. There’s only about 5-10ft (depending on tide) of non-rocky wading before getting into some less pleasant surface to stand on. Beach officially doesn’t allow alcohol on it, but the rules seem pretty relaxed. Most people are drinking casually. Waves are pretty absent. Overall, not bad — Still Hawaii so you can’t complain!!

The Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon beach is a great spot for swimmers of all levels from novice to expert. even thrill-seeking adventurers can be seen plan@ Boogie boarding snorkeling to ripping the waves out at Kaiser's world famous surf spots quote the Kaiser Bowl on quote from your little cake he's too seasoned citizens of all ages... The view is unspeakable with the Hilton Hawaiian Village rainbow Tower hovering above with its beautiful mural and LED lights at night panoramic in the scenery of scenic Beauty!

This is an amazing beach, I highly recommend checking it out. Due to the coral in relatively close proximity the water on this side of the island is much warmer than it is elsewhere. Warmer than Hanauma Bay and much warmer than it is at Waikiki. The surf here is very calm, hardly any waves at all, we took our 3 year old here and she has an absolute blast.

The sand here is unbelievably fine, it feels incredible. This is a launch location for Kayak tours, so you will need to be mindful of that, but there is a designated swim area that they are not allowed to paddle around, only launch out and come back in through.

Beautiful views of Diamond Head in the background!  Small, course sand with a lot of rocks.  Nice and quiet in the morning but near noon, there’s a lot of people.  Excellent place for wedding on the beach photos, in the morning

name: Nu‘uanu Pali Lookout
address: Nuuanu Pali Dr, Kaneohe, HI 96744, USA
reviews: The view is incredible from this lookout and the plaques throughout the attraction share some history as well. It's a great place to really appreciate Hawaiian culture and their history even if what happened here wasn't great. When we went it was pretty windy so maybe bring a light sweater with you just in case.

The lookout is free. But you have to pay a flat rate parking fee of $3, regardless of the time you spend 'looking out'.
Someone is always watching/supervising/policing the lot. 
🚙 Be careful. 

You won't regret the $3 fee. The Pali Lookout is amazing and a great photo op.

Aloha.

DEFINITELY a spot you MUST visit. Do whatever you need to and get up here! There is a easy drive up here or you can do what we did and hike!

The view is fantastic and the wind gets really crazy! It's really cool to stand up here by the ledge and enjoy the view of the mountains on both sides, green everywhere and the city and the sea in the distance!

This place is breathtaking. The views are phenomenal and is a must do when on the island.
I recommend going before the sun starts to set as the light conditions are so much better in the morning, or around midday

You have to pay a set fee for parking but it is valid for all day.

This lookout has the most stunning views of the island. High up in the mountains the view looks down the settlements and forest below. Parking is $3 no matter how long you stay. We only stayed for the lookout but there is also a few trails to do. All the money from parking goes to the upkeep of the area. The lookout is about a minute from the car park so we only spent about 10 minutes there. It gets extremely windy up there so you'll need to hold on to your hat.

name: Koko Crater Botanical Garden
reviews:
Cons: Limited paths and large stretches of common weeds between exhibits.

Pros: Curated areas have amazing specimens of unusual plants from all over the world. I went to the upland palm exhibit. The plumeria grove at the entrance is amazing. They were just starting to bloom now (start of second week of February) I suspect that at the end of the month it will be full of gorgeous blossoms. It would be an awesome spot for a picnic.

This is a bottom of Koko crater, so it may be very humid and hot depending on the day and season. But if you took the right day, it is such a peaceful short hiking site with cool breeze. Especially around the entrance area has tons of plumeria trees, smells really good! Going with a pair of shoes is recommended.

Gorgeous garden! It's in a very dry part of the island, so there's lots of cacti and trees, but it's not super lush-green like the gardens on the windward side (eastern coast). There's tons of plumeria trees and benches underneath. A great place to relax, read a book, make art, or meditate. There's also a 2-3 mile dirt road around the property that makes for a beautiful afternoon stroll to see plants from all over the world growing in harmony. It's also a great place to escape crowds as well, as it's normally quiet.
Well worth the hike up. You won’t think so on the hike down though.  Beautiful views all around. Good!
It was nice, quiet, and peaceful. My girlfriend and I had a nice time walking through. Lots of flowers and cool trees from all over the world.

name: Waikīkī Aquarium
reviews: Short walk through exhibits  We went through twice. Loved the fish and seahorse exhibits.  We did this before our flight going home. Not expensive at all. Gift shop was small but I found great unique items. Beautiful walk along the beach.

Within easy waking distance of Waikiki Beach. It has nice displays, several beautiful tanks, a large fish gallery with a shark, and an adorable leopard seal outside 😍 the sea dragon's and several seahorses tanks were an absolute favorite. Would make for a great stop for families with small children. Indoor and outdoor exhibits. It's not a huge facility but it is nice, has clean restrooms, and a cute gift shop. Oh, and the jellyfish tanks are very pretty too!

Almost feels like this attraction should have been part of the zoo due to its location and size. Nothing too spectacular here. Just your run of the mill aquarium. The sea lions are cool if you arrive on time to see them.

Moderate sized aquarium with a rich history run by the University of Hawaii.  We spent about 90 minutes going through at a modest pace, which I felt was perfect.  Really enjoyed the jelly fish, octopus, and tropical fish exhibits. Very few dedicated parking spots, just plan on parking elsewhere and walking a bit.

The Waikiki Aquarium contains the right amount of exhibits for a visit. There are enough exotic specimens to interest about anyone. They have less outdoor exhibits than some bigger aquariums; but I don't think many folks would stay out in that tropical sun very long anyway. I was able to put into use the advice the marine biologist gave about the proper distance to stay away from a beached monk seal. I encountered one and did accordingly with no incident.

name: Try Scuba Diving Honolulu
reviews: Go try this if you want an awesome peaceful experience on the island. It's a short tour around the lagoon. We saw a ton of fish and coral.  Zola is a great instructor and very chill. He will make sure you understand everything and are comfortable with what you are doing. It was a very relaxing experience!

I was really unsure about doing this but it ended up exceeding all of my expectations. It was super fun and well worth the price. Bruce was our instructor and was really cool and helpful. He took great care of our group and made it all seem pretty easy. I would highly recommend doing this.

Highly recommend "try scuba diving"! Bruce and violet were great instructors and love what they do. They helped all of us individually so we all would be comfortable. Nice remote location with little to no people on beach or in water. 

This experience will be for people that haven't scuba dived or is interested in getting into it

Best experience yet on the island!  I was a little hesitant about which company to go with, but Try Scuba Diving was awesome!  Bruce and Violet were great getting us comfortable and making sure we were all ready before taking a deeper plunge to deeper waters.  Highly recommended if you have a couple hours early in your day.  DON'T EAT before you dive.

Zola was an amazing instructor! I am excited to come back and get certified as a diver with him. :)

Side note - someone else was in trouble and Zola was able to go rescue the person even before the lifeguard could get to him. Felt super safe with him all the time.

name: Children's Discovery Center
reviews:
This place was one of the best things to do with my toddler. He absolutely loved it as did we. So much to see and do. Super friendly staff. Super clean environment. We only stayed about 2 hours but he could have played there all day. There is a cafe there to get food which is nice but they only accepted cash. Cant think of anyway this place can be improved exact cards accepted in the cafe

Please give me a "like"!
It's a place I take my son's to let their imagination run wild. A variety of cool things to keep your child occupied. It's also a nice escape from the heat

This is the best children's museum in the entire United States! The entrance price is great, as well as the way the center is organized. Downstairs is dedicated to gigantic body functions, community service jobs, restaurant chef, police, dentist, baseball hitting practice, race cars, and then a whole room dedicated to reading with an actual library with about 500 books, a gigantic reading chair, a real storyteller/reader. Then the next two floors are dedicated to the other Polynesian countries with dress up clothes, play food, games, books, culture activities as well as an airline flight simulator that really works, and every area has full costume dress up for what ever the activity happens to be, such as a pilot, airline hostess, etc. If I lived here full time, I'd have a membership. It's fantastic!. Oh, and the cafe has the most reasonable prices I've ever encountered.
I went with my family. It was much improved from the last time I went. Though it is pricey in my opinion. We really enjoyed the waterplay area.

This is a great place for children...preschoolers to elementary.  Everything is "hands-on."  No matter what style of learner a child is, their interest is captured, i.e. auditory, oral, kinesthetic, visual.  It does not matter if a child has challenges or is advanced, this is the place to bring your child(ren).  💞

As for "big kids", they have things for us to do, too.  My favorite place is the Story Room...the big over-stuffed chair and wall to wall books!!  I'm sure you can find your favorite!!  And let's not forget the fireplace.  All that makes for a cozy place to be!!  I failed to mention, there is a rocking chair, too.  😉

name: Kūhiō Beach
reviews: Beautiful beach. You can enjoy more still water because of the breakwater, and this part of the beach alongside Waikiki seems more quiet in general. There are many people around but that definitely doesn't mean it's not relaxing and enjoyable. You can take in the sunshine and all the beauty of the place! If you want waves and action, go on over to Waikiki Beach; this isn't your place.
Great for all ages. The sea wall provides an area protected and sandy and warmer waters. Great fit paddle boating and surfing. Crowded, your typical busy beach located in the heart of Wikiki.
We came here because we have small children and the beach here is protected by a rock wall and the water depth is very shallow up to the wall.  Beautiful beaches at an iconic part of Waikiki.
Calmer than the rest of Waikiki. Has walls around it to keep the surf down. Great for smaller kids, but still in the heart of Waikiki.
Was a great kid friendly beach.  With the rocks there it made it very nice for the kiddos, perfect ocean swiming for younger kids.

name: Foster Botanical Garden
address: 180 N Vineyard Blvd, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Great lush garden full of beautiful foliage and varying trees. Cute little conservatory housing different orchids and leaf hybrids. I loved listening to the bird songs that were all around and the butterfly garden is great. Definitely worth $5 just to come see the cannonball tree and rainbow eucalyptus. ($3 for residents, $25 for a year pass) The paper map they give you is easy to navigate and informative. I'll definitely be back often!

Great little sanctuary in Honolulu. Wonderful old trees and a variety of other trees and shrubs.  Not very many were flowering while we were there, but that could be the time of year.  There were a number of orchids and other flowers in the conservatory.

Last, but definitely not the least, is a rainbow eucalyptus.  It was tough to get good pictures due to the time of day and angle of the sun, but it was very pretty.

WE went to 3 botanical gardens in Oahu and this was THE BEST of all of them. And the best of any botanical garden in the states that we have been to. We saw SO many birds and lizards and the trees are incredible. The grass is so soft you could walk on it with just your feet. I am not uploaded all of the photos of the TREES because you will just have to go see for yourself. I would literally bet anyone $100 that they will be amazed when they come to this place and I would be rich.

This was one of my favorite botanical gardens. The guide was very informative, and we felt like we left really understanding the collection and its value. 

There are parts of this garden that are NOT paved, so wear shoes you don't mind getting a little muddy. If it does rain, while you're there, then the garden does have umbrellas available for you to borrow! Definitely at least take a picture of the bird checklist too before you start walking the garden. We saw so many unique birds and I was grateful I took the photo to carry with us.

Beautiful. Lovely landscaping. A nice relaxing escape in the middle of a bustling city. Beauty everywhere, and you can stay and wander the grounds as long as you like. They also have a guided tour at 10:30, it's recommend calling in advance to secure your spot. Picture just can't even begin to express the beauty.

name: Koko Head District Park
reviews: This is my all time favorite hike. It's a straight shot, and is a good medium difficulty, but they only time I've seen anyone turn around is my cousin and her friends because they were convinced there were giant centipedes everywhere. Which, maybe, but chances are pretty high that you could avoid them if you saw them, (I haven't), but anyway. The hike is great, and the views are better. There are a couple of good vantage points and some rock surfaces to sit on close to the edge, just be aware that it's a fall you should probably avoid

My family and I visited Koko Crater Regional Park for a quick hike to get a little exercise and see some great views. Koko Crater Trail is a 1/2 - 2 mile trail that is definitely very heavily trafficked out and back. The trail is located very close to Honolulu, Oahu, Hawaii that features beautiful wild flowers, spectacular views and is primarily used for hiking, running, nature trips, and bird watching. The trail is rated as difficult and is accessible year-round.

Truly enjoyed the experience here at the park where it wasn’t super busy and you can enjoy the waters. There was fresh water to wash off sand and lots of cranes chilling around the park. Loved spending time with my family here and would definitely do it again and it’s so beautiful and relaxing to be at!!! Highly recommended!!!

Did the railway hike here. Its a tough climb but truly worth it. You have to park in the car park near the baseball field and walk to the start of the railway. From here the gradient of the track gradually increases untill you reach the base of the mountain. From here it goes to easily a 70/75° angle for the majority of the way up. It must be noted that before this point there is an elevated, bridge like, section that runs for about 10 meters with a 5 meter drop below. The sleepers are spaced quite close together here but there is also an easy route to the right for those not keen on going over it. Once at the top the views are amazing in every direction with the sense of accomplishment when you look down at what you've just climbed backing them up. We did the walk when there was a few showers every now and then. This made the sleepers quite slippy so great care was needed on the way down. One of the best walks we've done on the island by far.

The whole hike follows a deserted train track. It has a hollow portion in the middle (but there is a safe path if you are not comfortable with height) and is pretty steep in the last portion. The view at the top is amazing and the hike is a good workout! It's better to have proper shoes, not sandals.

name: Makapuʻu Beach
reviews: Beautiful beach, I come here every time I go to Oahu. Currently the beach is “closed” according to signs but people still can go on the rockier areas towards the tide pools and smaller pockets of sand as opposed to the main beach. It’s super peaceful and there aren’t many tourists in the winter/early spring due to the riptides.

Nice beach to enjoy some tide pools and look for creatures amongst the rocks.

Also fun to play in the waves and relax on the beach (not crowded at all).

Downside is it's pretty rocky.

The beach was breathtakingly beautiful with bright blue water against dark volcanic rocks. We didn’t see anyone in the water because the surf was strong that day. Not a very busy place, we only saw a handful of other people wandering around. A must stop if you’re in the area just to take in the beautiful scenery. Restroom facility was decent.
It was a very pretty beach. The fish were all different colors. The water was very cold.but I loved it.
Beautiful beach, but get there early to avoid the crowds. Easily accessible restroom and shower facilities. Big surf.

name: Spitting Cave
reviews: Easy to get to. Beautiful views. Keep an eye out to the right and you'll often be able to see a few sea turtles if you hang out long enough. The cave is really cool to see and can give you some awesome video. It's never been really crowded in the few times I've gone. Take a short trip to China walls of you're in the area as well.

Just simply beautiful. Be very careful when you're out there do not fall off the cliff or slip. Great place to watch the sunset, or fish.  The waters are incredibly clear and blue, and The Rock lava formations beautiful.

Breath taking views , best views and picture taking during mid day but caution its very tricky going down the path to see this beautiful place so please use your own discretion when going down the path and when going back up its also much more harder when going back up. I do not recommend young children going down there cause its very dangerous as for young teens its up to the parents to decide if its safe for them( sorry young ones and teens I'm only looking out for everyones safety). I recommend using shoes when going here...there is street parking in a quiet safe neighborhood. Overall the reward is breathtaking Have a much Aloha stay.

Fantastic spot to view the cave from a small cliff. The waves bounce off the walls making the cave "spit" it back out. Great vistas of diamond head too. Lot of the kids like to jump off the cliff here but it's dangerous as the shoreline is rocky and the ocean currents can be strong. Definitely not recommended. But you can get some cool pics and watch the water spray off the cliffs and cave. It's a short hike down. Steep in some spots but short. It's easily doable. Great spot to visit while on Oahu.
I could have sat watching the cave for hours. Also spotted some whales and a sea turtle. It's a great place to watch a sunset. The pathway down is not for the faint of heart.

name: Mānoa Falls Trail
address: Na Ala Hele, Honolulu, HI 96822, USA
reviews: A family friendly trail if you are brave enough! Make sure to wear comfortable shoes as it gets slippery and mud! Great views the whole trail! Very humid!

Very awesome hike. Only .8miles. Lots of older people on the hike, but most definitely experienced. The hike itself when my wife, daughter, and I went was very muddy and slippery. Lots of bamboo to choose from for walking support though. It's worth it, to see the 50ft waterfall!

Absolutely loved this trail. It is so beautiful, and in the first bits of the hike, you get stunning views of the area that basically makes you think you're in Jurassic Park. The views are unbelievable, and with the birds chirping, truly feels like paradise. Past that though, it starts getting quite damp and muddy, and very easy to lose your grip. The park has considerately places rugs on these paths to help you get a good foothold. But still, it is very muddy since it's a rainforest area. At the end of the trail is a waterfall. Unfortunately for us, the waterfall wasn't full but rather a dinky little thing. 

The park provides a washing station for your shoes after the hike. There are also washrooms available. Parking fee is $5 but the parking lot is a mess because the lot is small and tough to accommodate all of the people visiting. The park is closed for majority of the week due to maintenance so check the times before you go. 

Also please be considerate. The paths are narrow and the tourists are so rude. They cut people, push oncoming people. Be patient so everyone can be safe and enjoy the hike.

Parking was easy for the $5. The trail was beautiful, but very muddy and slippery. Also very crowded, so there were bottlenecks in places the trail was narrow. Beautiful falls! I wish people would be considerate and obey the signs!

This is a nice, fairly easy hike. I think it's less then 2 miles back and forth but can be very, very muddy (be careful on slippery rocks). Wear shoes that can get dirty and plenty of bug repellent. Lots of pretty trees/forest, bamboo, and creeks to see. The waterfall isn't super majestic (especially depending on amount of rainfall) but it's still beautiful. We always have fun stomping through the mud and laughing at each other trying not to slip on our butts. My 3 year old was able to manage this hike with very little assistance. 

There is a parking lot that costs $5 or you can always park farther down the street for free. And thankfully there is a water hose in the parking lot you can use to wash off the mud.

name: Wiliwilinui Hiking Trail
reviews: This trail is a treat, it’s well worth the couple hours walking to the Summit. It hadn’t rained so the path was not muddy, though some spots had ropes if you required. We hiked at midday and were happy with a number of covered spots along the way to shade us on the ascent. The lush greens and the gorgeous blue sky led the way with sweeping views down the valley and towards the sea.

Amazing views, but got stuck there during longer than usual rain when the trail turns into a muddy river:) although afterwards it's fine. Couldn't go all the way to the top  - too slippery for me, and all of sudden developed a fear of heights 🤷

A simply amazing hike! Take a taxi there and you won't have to worry about parking. The hike takes you all the way up the mountain along a ridge, so there are views for days all the way. Bring a jacket or something warm for the top - it can be very windy and sometimes wet too. Prepare for muddy conditions, and some strenuous climbing. Lots of traffic here but worth it!

AMAZING! the trail gets difficult for the last 3/4 mile up but it's worth it. Go slow and watch your footing. Once you get to the top where there's a radio tower, go to the left and continue the trail to the next peak only a little further away. There is a bench to sit down on and you can look over the other side. Also a great spot to watch the clouds roll over the crest of the mountain.
Beautiful hike. It started down pouring while we were up there but it was still fun. Would recommend. It is alot of steps but feels good when your up there. I recommend going on a non cloudy day.

name: WWII Red Light District Tour
reviews: Great tour!  We had a lovely time learning about WWII and all of the history within China town. Carter also has a vast amount of historical knowledge about other sites and times of Honolulu,  and we loved hearing about those, as well. Great tour for both  history buffs as well as those not as familiar with the time (we had both in our group!).

Great tour!  Had fun learning about a side of WW2 that is not talked about.  Highlight was the Smith Union Bar, my husband laid his Dad's WW2 picture from China town in 1942 on the bar and did a shot of Whiskey with the owner.  Papa's shot was poured out in his honor.  We put this in the must do category if you are on Oahu.
If you're in downtown Honolulu and have a free morning or afternoon, go on this tour! I did it...twice! That's how interesting it is. Carter brings the era and its characters back to life.

I highly recommend. Great tour and fun, informative guide. She has wonderful stories and photos to help you get the feel of that time. She is not just a tour guide but a history buff and continues to research the history of the area.
Great tour by Carter! Fun presentation and walking tour - We have come to chinatown for ages for food, snacks etc - but Never knew the WWII history of the area. Definitely recommended!

name: Lulumahu Falls
reviews: A truly exhausting hike with a nice pay off! I haven't been hiking in about 10 years & yet I thought I would be prepared for this. The mud, rocks, and trees are NOT a joke on this trail. If you're an avid hiker I'm sure that won't be a problem for you, but the constant slipping and ducking and hoisting and tip-toeing on rocks across the river were quite exhausting for this novice. Sunning view at the falls made it worth it though!

Great hike. Wear hiking shoes or shoes you are ok with getting muddy. You'll cross the stream a few times and the ground is slippery and muddy. I would recommend using a walking stick or a piece of bamboo. Well worth the hike to the falls!! Absolutely stunning water fall!!!!

Awesome hike, made me feel like a wannabe jungle explorer. Shoulda brought my machete, whip, and Indiana Jones hat! Definitely wear water boots without socks. It's a muddy and wet trail. Several ankle deep river crossings. Very slippery from all the mud and algae on rocks. Not for folks that like to stay clean and tidy. Sometimes, it's fun to be dirty!

We missed the initial right turn sign from the parking lot and ended up following the access road back and picking up the trail behind the back fence.
The trail crosses back and forth over the stream. There are several options, many marked with ribbons. Just don't stray far from the stream. The trail can be very muddy.
Fun little hike.  Most challenging part was finding the right trail at the onset. Luckily some locals were about and pointed us in the right direction.

name: Hanauma Bay
reviews:
Swim in a real-life aquarium! Great 1/2 day trip. Water is crystal clear and the fish are plentiful, and come in all shapes and sizes and colours. Parking is limited so we decided to take the #22 bus from Waikiki which was easy and convenient and only $2.75 each way (one bus every hour/ 45 min journey time). The bus will drop off and pick up in the car park at Hanauma Bay. 
We arrived at 08h45 and the beach was quiet, but it got pretty busy very quickly. 
Snorkel gear available for hire on the beach. 
Bring food/ snacks with as there aren’t many options available.

Great place to relax and snorkel. Cheap entrance fee and you can bring your own gear, significantly reducing cost.

Highly recommend supporting this place to help maintain and preserve this natural beauty. Don't touch the coral and wear coral-safe sunblock!

Such an amazing experience. My first time snorkeling and it couldn't have been easier. There's an orientation video you have to watch that explains the rules of the bay and gives the back story of how it was formed. 

I would suggest going early in the morning as it does get crowded later in the morning. There is a shuttle to take guests up and down the hill, its inexpensive.

Beautiful beach. Unfortunately, that's likely the problem. Too many people and like so many other reefs the coral seems to be mostly dead (at least closer to the shore). If the wind and waves are up you likely won't be able to snorkel the deeper reef, but that makes sense for safety. I think a large number of people that go to the bay are not strong swimmers. The conservation needs to enforce reef safe sunscreen ONLY! I saw people using all kinds of aerosol sunscreen. At least provide free samples of reef safe sunscreen and advocate for purchasing reef safe sunscreen at the gift shop. Maybe even remove people from the bay that don't follow the rules regarding reef safe sunscreen.

Nice beach with above average snorkeling in pretty clear water.  Water is fairly shallow so even beginners to snorkeling will feel comfortable in the water.  Water and beach was very busy but that was expected.  Snorkeling is best past the breakwater but only for good swimmers.

name: Best of Hawaii Tours and Activities
address: 1690 Ala Moana Blvd Unit 102, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA
reviews: I only have 2 more days here and needed something awesome to do! Abraham helped me fill my time with some amazing adventures! He went above and beyond to help my time left in this paradise fabulous! Great prices and even greater customer service. Thank you SO much!

Definitely will be using Best Of Hawaii again.  Abraham was my go to guy throughout my entire trip in Hawaii. He would go out of his way to make sure all my needs were met. I had two of my buddies that decided to show up last minute and he was able to add them into my activities without a problem and with a positive attitude, which made my entire experience much smoother and enjoyable.

Abraham was amazing - he went above and beyond in helping me book my activity. Initially, he had contacted me when there were no availabilities for a package ATV and zip line. We booked the zip line and to my surprise he contacted me a couple of weeks later to try to coordinate the package! I was super excited and appreciated Abraham’s tenacity and desire to ensure that I had the best time on the island.  

I will update this review once I do the zip line/ATV tomorrow 🤗

Booking for our upcoming honeymoon, we were in great hands with Carlos.
He was absolutely sensational. 
Beyond helpful. Very friendly. Very knowledgeable. 
Stress free. Good pricing.
Had our best interests in mind. 
Cannot fault him or his high level of customer service.
We're looking forward to it :)

Carlos was awesome!  We were booking activities on our own and, evidently booked an ATV adventure on another island!  Carlos called to verify that this is what we wanted (we did not!) and he cancelled that booking for us and helped us book one on our island!  He was also very personable!  Thanks, Carlos!

name: Diamond Head Beach Park
address: 3300 Diamond Head Rd, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA
reviews: If you want to get away from the crowds, take a walk or bus/trolley down past the lighthouse. Quieter beach with beautiful views, and you'll get the sun from a different angle in the afternoon for sunbathing. No bathrooms tho so keep that in mind

A nice low impact walk takes you to the top. By low impact I mean “no serious climbing” but “don’t forget there are still stairs in front of you.” When you get to the top you can choose to go right or left for the final ascent. Right takes you through the internal military facility complete with old metal staircases and corresponding claustrophobia. To the left are simply stairs. The view from the top is worth the walk.
Stunning Views once you get at the top. Wear sneakers and get plenty of water. Great hike even for kids.
My wife and I made the climb while she was 5 months pregnant. We were not disappointed when we reached the top! Beautiful views!
Amazing views with virgin beaches at the bottom. Make sure you don't fall...;)

name: Hanauma Bay Nature Preserve
address: 100 Hanauma Bay Rd, Honolulu, HI 96825, USA
reviews:
This beach was very clean and organized. The presentation they require you sit through prior to coming into the beach was very nicely thought out. 
We went snorkeling and the equipment was affordable to rent and no wait time. 
We saw lots of tropical fishes and didn’t have to swim out too far. 
Very fun thing to do with your spouse/family.

This place is beautiful and to me it is a must-see if you visit Oahu! The number of fish you see and the great variety of sea life is so fun! A monk seal swim up to the shore and took a nap on the beach during our last visit. The staff had a safe area around him roped off and taught a little class about them and answered questions, which was great! It tends to get very crowded, so it is definitely best to arrive early in the morning to get a parking spot. It is well run and looks great, but I do wish that people would be more careful not to step on the coral, especially after being educated by the video!

I absolutely love Hanauma Bay! It’s a great place to pack a lunch and spend the afternoon. If you do decide to enjoy the bay, please wear coral reef safe sunscreen and pay attention to the educational video. If we want this beautiful place to thrive we must do our part.

Unforgettable experience! Extensive coral reef in an extinct volcano crater, maintained as a nature preserve by the University of Hawaii. Plan on spending the day to fully explore the many coral formations abundantly populated by numerous tropical fish species.

Absolutely beautiful. The story behind the bay makes it even better. The staff does a great job keeping this place looking in great condition and there is a lot of fish in the bay you can see while snorkeling. Highly recommend if you visit Oahu.

name: Sea Life Park Hawaii
reviews: Our family goes to Sea Life Park pretty often. Probably because we have annual passes. We enjoy the shows, the touch pool area, the playground, the food, and the scenery. Our children enjoy it a lot too and that's mainly why we go. Every time we go we experience something different and always positive. Oh and they added a conservation area which is educational and neat. Definitely check that out if you have a chance. We're going to renew our annual pass this month and continue to enjoy the sea life here as a family.

This was a nice little park but emphasis on the "little".  There wasn't much to do and see.  It was quite out of the way, so we ate there too (food was pretty disappointing and amusement park prices).  The dolphin show was good and feeding the birds was cool, but we could've walked around the park and seen everything in an hour.  It wasn't worth the admission cost.

Solid park.  I would highly recommend and give it 4 stars if you were driving as oppose to taking a tour bus or public transportation.  That way, you can stop and take in the beautiful scenery at various lookout points along the way. 

 The park itself only deserved 3 stars though.  My kids enjoyed the the aviary where they can feed the birds.  The dolphin and seal shows were also enjoyable.  We spent about 4 hours here.

I wouldn't buy the general admission at full price (39.99)  AAA offers a discount and you can find various discounts in various tourism brochures available at the airport or in Waikiki.

I can't say anything about the dolphin experience as we didn't get that.  Costco on Oahu has discounts for that though.

I would recommend going here on discounted days. I don't believe it's worth the full price unless you decide to pay for the different experiences they offer. 

It's great for small children as it's not crowded and it's a good bit of animals to see. 

Parking is $5 so be prepared for that.

Very interactive park experience for the kids. Focused on loving marine life and learning about it. We were there for 3 hours with 3 kids and saw everything including the dolphin show, which I highly recommend.  We did the luau here and it was okay. My teenager and tween found it a little hokey, but the performers were amazing and the food was quite good and the activities as the luau began were fun and created souvenirs.

name: Dolphin Quest Oahu - Swim with Dolphins
reviews: This was such a great experience for my daughter and I. While I was in Mexico I went for a dolphin experience and this was 1000 times better. The instructors were very protective over these beautiful animals as they should be. They answered any questions we had and made sure that we had one on one time. I love how if the dolphins weren’t interested in coming over they just leave them and how great it was that they loved to perform. We could tell that the instructors had a very special relationship with them. I would highly recommend this encounter for anyone

Treat yourself and participate in this experience. I can't imagine anyone who wouldn't enjoy this. It's located in the Kahala Hotel and Resort, but you certainly do not have stay there to book the experience. The staff are so friendly, and the dolphins are wonderful! You're in a small group, so you actually get time to touch the animals and ask questions. The space is enclosed, so everything feels very contained, but in a good way. This is not a "swim withe dolphins" experience. It's an opportunity to see them in action, understand them, and watch them show off. Highly recommend.

This was an amazing experience. It truly was an honor to be in the presence of these intelligent animals. This was a bucket-list item for me and it did not disappoint. The trainer was super and she clearly loves what she does. It is pricey, but if this is something you’ve wanted to do, don’t hesitate. Do it. You won’t regret it. I have a lifetime of amazing memories!

Hannah was the best guide.  Everyone was professional, kind and shared the ways in which the dolphins are cared for and why this is the best environment for them.  Hannah encouraged us to take steps to protect wild dolphins by reducing single use plastics.  Beautiful animals in a beautiful setting with caring people! Would definitely recommend.

Our 5 grandchildren each had age-related good experiences with the dolphins. Approx. an hour of interactive instruction and about 40 minutes with the dolphins. Small groups of 5 or 6 participants, referring to each by name. Parents can sit in on educational preface, and leaders include you by name, too.

name: Halona Blowhole Lookout
reviews: Beautiful place for a quick stop. Easy to park. Views were perfect. Blowhole is not easy to spot but awesome when you do see it. I also saw a few turtles down in the gorgeous blue water.

Great place to stop if your driving past. We were lucky to come on a day where the ocean was quite rough. This made for great activity coming from the blowhole. You don't really need to spend more than 15/20 minutes here as apart from the blowhole and views there isn't much else to see. The car park is quite small but has a high turnover rate so you won't be waiting long for a space.

It was such an amazing sight to witness. Got to trek down the path a little to see cool layers of rock and feel the splash from the ocean. Definitely a great little treat next to the highway and won’t take up too much of your busy holiday schedule :)

Decent amount of parking and even if it's full the turnover is pretty fast so with minimal patience you'll get a spot. 

While the actual action depends on the wave action, direction and even tide it can range from minimal to amazingly large spouts of water. But even if it's not going you can still catch some amazing views of Destiny Beach and Sandy Beach. 

Definitely worth a quick stop.

This is one of those scenic spots that makes you feel both on top of the world and terrifyingly small in the same breath. I live on Oahu yet keep returning to this tourist-filled spot because it’s so well-placed. Parking can be a little tough sometimes with tour buses cycling through, but it turns around quickly, so if you’re willing to cycle around a couple of times you’ll get a spot even when it’s busy.

name: Hawaiian Luau
reviews: We’re saving money to shopping here! Yahoo!
Aloha, It's a fun place friends, check it out.

Great places to visit. So relaxing and interesting. Makes trip to Hawaii really enjoyable and memorable. Hawaii is Heaven on Earth. Nature is incredibly beautiful. gorges beaches, tasty delicious food but hospitality of the people is what will create great lasting memories. They are very kind and welcoming to tourists. Unmatched hospitality. Aloha Hawaii!

Our guide was Shannon!  Fun and informative, fed us yummy local snacks all while providing amusing commentary.  We did the early tour that covers Honolulu to North Shore.  Fresh shrimp was amazing from local grower.  Ask lots of questions, live your best life and enjoy.

This tour was so awesome!  The guide was super funny ! Friendly ! Thoughtful ! Personable ! Knowledgeable on everything good around the island ! By the end I learned tons of very cool things about the Hawaiian life with awesome sights and pictures  ! culture ! history ! habitat ! Secret beaches ! Local hangouts and activities !  You're missing out big time if you don't hit this tour while in Oahu ! Ask for Miah without a doubt ! CHEEEHOOO COUSIN !!!

name: Star of Honolulu
address: Pier 8, Aloha Tower Marketplace, 1 Aloha Tower Dr, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews: A great organization to go whale watching with. There are 5 different levels to whale watch from from inside to upper outside decks. Not only did we see a few pods of whales we also say dolphins and a sea turtle. The views from the boat out at sea looking back at Honolulu are breathtaking. I highly enjoyed this whale watching cruise.

Nice boat, lunch buffet is decent. Wish they were better at announcing the whale sitings. Best to go to top deck and just walk back and forth until you see them. Location is somewhat difficult to find. Should have better signs showing where you're located once people get to the tower you are "supposedly" located at.

It's okay. If you like a cruise and just want to spend with your loved ones, should be okay. But nothing sort of ultimate experience. Food was  okay and the dances provided there , are pretty basic. You can find much better dances at Waikiki mall.

Booked the Star of Honolulu for my boyfriend's birthday and we had a great time. The food was delicious and the crab was all-you-can-eat. The views were beautiful and the staff was very friendly. The hula shows were entertaining and we very much enjoyed our time. Highly recommend.

I've used this cruise twice to go whale watching and have seen whales each time. Both times were in February. The crew is so nice and helpful. The second cruise we did we saw multiple whales breach and the captain said "that was a once in a lifetime experience." We saw dolphins as well.

name: USS Bowfin Submarine Museum & Park
address: 11 Arizona Memorial Dr, Honolulu, HI 96818, USA
reviews:
This is a short tour of a historic submarine. Prices were fair for military members. During your tour you have a headset that describes different parts of the submarine to you. It even has recordings of Veterans sharing their personal experiences. It was definitley worth the trip.

 I will say it's not handicap friendly as you climb up/down things and through small holes.

 You can't bring bags or purses, anything bigger than a small clutch / large wallet is a no go.

Museum was closed, No kids under 4 allowed. 1 star, because NO INFO about restrictions until you are buying the tickets, but they have a security check before, where   you can bring in only what in your pockets. Even baby food or diapers not allowed. I'll understand it, if they provided any baby food or drink for babies or diaper stations, but... Nothing. 5 hrs for kids without food if you want to visit USS Missouri.

Loved it! Make sure to get the audio guide. It’s a really cool experience and I learned a lot. 

Its a shame the most interesting parts of Pearl harbor at an additional coast. Also charging more than the entry price for a “newspaper photo” seems disproportionate. There might be a better way to sell them than printing everyone’s photos only to throw them in the garbage afterward. Paper are trees and that’s definitely a waste of trees.
Good exhibit at Pearl Harbor.  You go at your own pace, with audio automatically triggered for each room.

The USS Bowfin Submarine Museum is more than what I ever expected. I took the audio tour of this historical piece of history. I just can't imagine living in the Close Quarters that are heroes did as they fought in World War II. The sacrifices made only goes to show why that generation is the greatest generation of our country today. It's nice to see that little pieces of our history are being maintained today to show and teach just exactly why we have the freedom we have today. If you're ever at Pearl Harbor I would highly recommend that you take the audio tour yourself of This Magnificent piece of History.

name: Lanai Lookout
reviews: Just beautiful. This is the prettiest, most scenic drives of my entire life. As soon as we turned this one bend of the road, my eyes instantly welled up because the beauty of it was so overwhelming❤ Definitely a must-see when in Oahu.
