Feel the great power of mighty nature. Big wind gust, huge splashing waves. I felt very very tiny standing at this lookout, and all life problems no longer seem to matter compared to the view in front of my eyes. It was very refreshing, quite glad to have made this stop!

Love this place, its incredible...the water is perfectly beautiful with several shades of blue. You can see whales offshore here and the breeze is always steady which feels great because it can get warm over on that part of the island

Nice stop along an island drive around.  Per someone else, just wait and a parking spot will free soon.  You need to go over the wall to get best views.  Note there is a sign to not go any further, although it appears everyone was well beyond the sign to get best photo and selfies.  It is pretty far from the water unless you climb all the way down, but not set up for stairs, so at your own risk.  Looks fairly manageable you can climb wall level easily.

If you are driving east along the coast and wanting to quickly stretch your legs then this is a great stop. The parking may be full when you first pull up, just wait for a few moments as people are constantly in and out of this parking lot. You will be able to see what the waves have done to the rocks over time and the amazing design on the rocks. If you hop the wall (at your own risk) you can walk down to get a closer look. The rocks if wet and also the sandy parts can be slick so be careful. You will love the designs on the rocks...they are great for photos. This is one of the quick pull outs that is says is worth the quick stop.

name: The Brewseum
reviews:
I love the decor in this place. It is like walking into an aviation museum. There is an actual small museum next door.

6 beers on tap with a whole range of cans and bottles. Make sure you try their brews before you try the rest. 

Great place for photos as well. You can jump in the Jeep and props (helmets, sailor hats) are available as well. 

Food is available as well.

A fine military themed watering hole that any service member past or present can come to and share stories and feel the steel, the brotherhood that binds us together. Sometimes we need to be around our brothers as we have a bond that is extremely tight.  I would like to see more military members there.  Especially my Marines,. Sometimes the boys need to be with the boys. A bond that is unbreakable.  Really enjoyed my visit here.
This is a great place for a drink.  But this is so much more than a speakeasy or a bar. This is a living and breathing museum. Beautiful and accurate artifacts

Such a fun bar with a cool and chill vibe. I completely felt like I was transported back into the 1940’s. The owners and employees were beyond friendly. They also had a great beer selection and solid cocktail menu at the speakeasy! I will definitely come back with friends.

This spot is a pretty unique idea for a bar, especially for lovers of WWII history. The bar itself looks sort of like an auto shop from the outside, so it can be a little hard to miss if you're not paying attention. Once inside, there are neat little Americana paraphernalia strewn about, which makes this a popular place for military folk to hang out. The downside though, is that they don't serve food here so you'll need to either eat before you come or satiate your appetite with the free popcorn they give out. They do have pizzas you can order at the bar but that's about it. 

The second part of this treat is the speakeasy located on the roof next door. When you walk in on the first floor, you're hit with a flash from the past with walls upon walls of WWII barracks-style memorabilia and decor. Once you get to the top, you have to knock on the door with the "secret knock" to be let in and you can make your way to the cocktail bar from there.

Parking is a real pain though as most of the street parking is private and you will likely be towed if you park there. The safest place to park is most likely the Ward center, so make sure to allot enough time to scout out a spot before you get there.

name: Summit of Diamond Head Crater
reviews: The views of Waikiki Beach, and all of Waikiki for that matter, are spectacular from the top of the Diamond Head Crater. It is so serene and peaceful at the top (besides the many people), and you feel quite cut off from the craziness of Waikiki. The hike to get to the summit isn't super difficult, but make sure to bring lots of water, especially if it's hot out. This is a hike that I have seen many families and older people do, but take a look at some of the other reviews to get a better all-around understanding of the difficultly level. If you're staying in Waikiki or on Oahu, I definitely recommend doing this hike! The breathtaking views at the top make it totally worth it!

For a one dollar admission the views are worth every penny. To echo every other review - go early! The park opens at 6am. We ran from our hotel to the site, were there by 10am and glad we were off the hill before 11:30am - as the crowds were beginning to come increase. 

I would recommend a pair of shoes (not sandals) for the hike as any precipitation can cause the rocks to become slippery. All in all - great hike!

Touristy but worth the trek. Bummed to see people wandering off trail, especially the instagrammers perched on top of the old military bunkers. The hike trail is mostly clear, but not paved. Wear athletic shoes and plan to get a good workout in. Too many tourists wearing fashion shoes and skirts! Arrive before 8am if you want to skip lines and the heat, though anytime before 9 isn’t too bad.
Fun hike. Takes about 45 minutes on average. Steep climbs and uneven terrain. You will love it once you get there, plus you can say you did it.
One of the most beautiful places I've ever seen. It's somewhat of a challenge going up but the view at the top and pineapple mango twist at the bottom make it well worth it. Must see...

name: Makapu‘u Point Lighthouse Trail
reviews: Amazing trail along the sea cliffs with the best view of Oahu southeastern shoreline. The views at the end of the trail is totally worth it and I would definitely recommend this trail as it gives one of the best views on Oahu. If you are lucky you can also see humpback whales. There is no shade during the entire trail so be advise to carry lots of water.

Great views from the top. The trail is all paved but it is quite a long steady uphill climb. You will be grateful for the strong ocean breeze. You can’t actually get very close to the actual light house. The scenery is spectacular.

What a beautiful place for a hike. Just be prepared, it's a hefty hike up and back. Make sure you bring water and sunscreen. It is not for the faint of heart. be prepared. If you're lucky, like we were, you'll get to see a pot of whales swimming by. It was a spectacular day.

This hike is very easy for all ages and abilities. The view during the hike is phenomenal, the whole way up and down there are places to rest and take in the sights. Because the trail is entirely paved, it is very stroller friendly. This hike is very popular with a lot of young families and elderly. So many cute dogs too! Definitely one of my favorite places to go and take visitors to the island.

This hike was INCREDIBLE. Absolutely breathtaking. Oh, and the best part... it's 100% paved! That means no muddy shoes (unlike most other hikes in Hawai'i).

The hike isn't very hard either. We saw young children and elderly people doing it. It's basically just uphill the whole way and downhill the whole way. Lots of incredible spots for photos. 

It will be windy the higher you go. I would recommend a light jacket or one with a hood. And bring a camera, of course. 

We didn't get to spot a whale but people do see them from the trail all the time.

name: Pearl Harbor National Memorial
address: 1 Arizona Memorial Pl, Honolulu, HI 96818, USA
reviews: Beautiful memorial with great views of the harbor and Ford Island. There's plenty of parking here and is also easily accessible by bus. Numbers 20 and 42 will bring you here from Waikiki at a cost of $5.50 for a day pass. It's strictly a no bag policy anywhere whilst inside the memorial and on the island so just don't bring one. If you do bring a bag then you'll have to pay $5 per bag to store it for the day. We arrived early in the morning, just as the park was opening. I would recommend doing the same as you entitle yourself to the free tickets for the USS Arizona Memorial. This is free anyway but at this time there's less crowds and you watch a short video with a bit of extra information from rangers. Once this was done we went on a short boat ride to the memorial itself spending approximately 15 minutes there and then came back to the centre. From here we got the shuttle across to the Missouri Memorial where we were able to look around and got guided tours included in the price of the ticket. It is truly a brilliant place to spend the day learning about history and paying your respects to those who lost their lives.

My trip to the Pearl Harbor Memorial has become a staple for visitors who come to the islands to visit. This time around it was my parents (who have grown into some stability issues with time) who came. Somewhat surprisingly, there were no issues regarding those stability concerns. There were ample places to sit down throughout the facility for them to rest which meant energy level wasn't an issue, either (Just understand that half the point of the place is resting or riding on water and pay close attention where needed.).  We got there early so the memorial still had plenty of free tickets to take advantage of. In addition to that, I purchased the audio tour which has several locations around the facility where additional explanations and content are given to the listener. It was a bit pricey, but worth it for at least one of them who wasn't as big of a history buff. If you get the earliest tickets, be prepared to jump into the first movie presentation and boat tour that they offer which gave me (just barely enough) time to purchase the audio tour and catch up. Following the combination of movie and boat tour, we were able to enjoy the rest of the audio tour, at our leisure. The content was all relevant to the memorial. The facilities were clean and well- kept (there was construction on the submarine memorial side but it did not detract from the visit).  There was also enough historic information provided without feeling overwhelmed by it. It has ramps and braille for visitors, but is otherwise mostly at ground level. They have a snack store on the premises and a busy souvenir shop to cap off the visit. We easily used three hours and felt like we could have spent longer. Definitely worth recommending and probably won't be my last visit.

Really nothing to complain about. The site was beautiful. The tour was excellent. And the people there really invite an atmosphere that appreciates the gravity of what happened there while keeping it enjoyable. Definitely try to visit if you're around!

A significant historical landmark. Very busy of course so tickets can be hard to get sometimes. The movie is moving and very well done. It sets the perfect mood for the rest of the visit. The memorial itself is lovingly taken care of and on clear days it's cool to be able to see most of the Arizona through the water. The park employees are knowledgeable and helpful. The Navy sailors who drive the ferry boats are professional and will try to answer your questions, but it's best to ask the actual national park workers if you have any. If it's excessively windy or if there's lightning in the area they may have to shut down the tour rides but that rarely happens. Worth your time!

This is a must see if you have any time on Oahu.  The obvious historical significance should be more than enough reason, but the exhibits and tours available make it very unique.  I first visited the Arizona memorial more than 40 years ago.  They've made significant improvements in every aspect of the experience and more are in process.  For younger kids it is probably not going to be something they enjoy, but for middle to high school kids with an interest in US history or WWII it will be worth almost a full day.

The views are spectacular, and it is relatively easy to put yourself back in time, to immerse yourself in the moments that changed lives almost 60 years ago.  

We arrived about 15 minutes before the memorial opened and the line was already huge.  I'm note sure when you need to arrive to be at the front of the line.  Once the line started moving it moved very quickly.  

You get a ticket and check in for a time to go out to the Arizona Memorial.  While you wait there are a variety of exhibits to walk through, and like I said you could spend the day at the site.

There is lots of free parking, but remember where you park and don't lock your keys in your car.  We tried to help two groups that locked their keys in their car on our way back to ours.

Dress for the weather.  You are going to be outside for the boat ride out to the Memorial, the Memorial is essentially open to the elements, and many of the exhibits are also open/outdoors.  Thankfully the weather is usually excellent.

name: Moanalua Gardens
address: 2850 Moanalua Rd A, Honolulu, HI 96819, USA
reviews: You can see these giant trees from the highway so we stopped by during vacation to take a closer look.  Amazing how big they are. We're visiting family from the mainland, so it's nice to see some unique birds and trees. Lots of Japanese tourists since its own/maintained by Hitachi

This is a really awesome park wow. This is also a really great place to have a wedding. So beautiful and historic. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. I highly recommend this place for even just a nice visit.
Very nice I had a great time there. Easy access from the highway and your experience here will be awesome. If you visit the islands of Hawaii this is a must see.

Moanalua Gardens is beautiful - lots of open space (lawn/grass) and some gorgeous trees including a HUGE monkey pod tree. Flowers, not so much. There are several interesting buildings including a Japanese tea house, and King Kamehameha V's summer cottage and a very ornate 1903 Chinese Hall. There is a koi pond, and lots of water fowl that are very comfortable around humans, but they don't bite (at least they didn't bite me). It is very open and though there were a few busloads of tourists while we were there, we wandered around without any problems - never felt crowded.

There was also a major woodshow there when we were there that was interesting and had some really nice wood art.

There's not a lot to do or see, and admission isn't much either ($1 for military).

It really is worth a visit, but the kids will hate you if you're taking them away from the beach or the pool.
Simply gorgeous.  Also, there was a rainbow off in the distance really making every photo perfect

name: Hawaiʻi State Capitol
address: 415 S Beretania St, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews:
As a 1st timer in Honolulu, you will like the place, it’s history and it’s opulence. Good spot yo spend 2 hours of quality time. 

Keep your lenses ready and clean as building and locale is very photogenic. Staff is very nice helpful and courteous. Walking tour add to your knowledge about the background and story about the place.

The Hawaii State Capitol building epitomizes the creative architecture of the early 60s. Soaring support columns rise out of flat pools. The inner courtyard makes you look skyward. Renovations are currently underway for upkeep.
It is a very distinctive Capitol building and unlike any other in the United States. The building is not the prettiest, but it's interesting to look at.

What a beautiful building!

It's surrounded by near by lush trees, and water fixtures. In the interior is a beautiful atrium.

There is so much unique architecture, I highly recommend a store to explore here!
Looks nice building. Never seen before

name: Round Top Forest Reserve
reviews: Absolutely gorgeous! What an amazing place to view the sunset. Get there early if you plan to get a decent spot. It's a very peaceful, relaxing place to spend the sunset. Be sure to wait until after the sun sets because the sky turns amazing colors. Spectacular view. Mother nature puts on a wonderful show.

Extremely clean reserve with an amazing view. At night it is extremely pretty. Over look the entire city. You can't enter the reserve but you can pull off on the side of the road just before it and take pictures. Absolutely breath taking. Just be sure you're careful of incoming cars.

The drive up to this place makes you feel like you are in a different planet. The view once you get to the top is just breath taking. They do mention that there is lots of car thief in the parking lot of the reserve and don’t take them lightly!

So beautiful! Vast vistas and dense, jungle-like foliage. Follow Round top loop for a lovely drive with many spectacular views of Honolulu. Hiking trails- many trail heads with parking - and a park with a lookout point.
Spectacular view of the Honolulu, airport and Perl Harbor! Easy drive. Limited parking! Restrooms located just prior to reaching the peak!

name: LeiGreeting.com
address: 3375 Koapaka St f245, Honolulu, HI 96819, USA
reviews: Drake was so awesome and friendly. He took our picture and gave us suggestions of things we may enjoy on the island of Maui. I surprised the rest of our group with the lies and they were all so pleased! Highly recommend.

First time visiting Hawaii for the youngsters in our group. The Lei greeting made it even more special and memorable! The young lady met us with a smile and was genuinely happy to greet us. She even went the extra mile and asked us if we knew where baggage claim was. We were not too sure and we wanted to walk some of the energy off of our littlest member as he had a pretty long flight of sitting still. She walked us all the way to baggage claim, making sure not to lose any of us in the hustle and bustle of the airport. Thank you for the lei greeting and the lasting memories!

Absolutely wonderful greeting! Our plane was delayed and I received a phone call just making sure everyone was ok and once we deplaned she was waiting right at the door of our jet bridge! absolutely special service and  my boyfriend was thrilled. We also got to keep our sign. Such a fun and memorable experience and welcome to Kauai!

I ordered this for my friends arriving in Oahu.  I used the website to order, and when one friend decided against going, I also called to change one of the names on the greeter card.  Phone experience was very pleasant and professional.  My friend texted me that they were greeted at the gate, and the greeter escorted them to baggage claim and gave help on getting to their rental car, which is more than I'd expected.  She was so happy with the leis and service.  Mahalo for your wonderful service!

So glad I scheduled a Lei Greeting.  They could not have made it any easier.  They had a professional sign made up at the bottom of the escalator when you went to baggage claim.  The girl who presented our Lei's could not have been friendlier, helpful and was even nice enough to take a photo of us.  Make sure you use this firm for your Lei Greeting.  Have to have one when you land in Paradise.  August 9, 2019

name: Waimānalo Beach Park
reviews: Great beach park with ample parking, bit of a shame about the tents pitched up by the side of the road though. The beach is amazing with beautiful white sand and crystal clear waters. The view of rabbit island is great, especially when the sun is shining and the water has different shades of blue. Awesome place to spend the day, would highly recommended.

Very nice beach. The facilities were great. It was nice to have lifeguards there just  to be on the safe side. The beach was very calm and the mountains in the background were an outstanding to see while swimming. The view is just amazing. Lovely place to stop.

This is honestly my favorite beach spot on Oahu. The views are spectacular and there is plenty of shade to relax and read. Like many who have visited before me there are caution signs posted for jellyfish and shore break. Please read and respect the signs! We prefer to bring a good book and enjoy a picnic here.

INSANELY BEAUTIFUL! Towering cliffs surrounding, islands off the coast, gorgeous white sand and stunning glowing blue-turquoise water. Beware of the man-I-War jelly fish in this side of the island though. Especially during high tide and/or high wind.

Out of the typical tourist path. Parked car almost ON beach. Tons of shade AND we had a hammock we could attach to trees there. The water was a little choppier on the day we went. Winds higher also, but its not always that way. Gonna go back. Considering the amount of people going to beaches ON A WEEKEND, this was an awesome gem. So few people. Actual lifeguard stand WITH someone there. Almost no seashells to speak of though. The beauty was spectacular though.

name: Waikiki Friday Fireworks
reviews: Pyrotec setup is right on the beach near the end of Kahanamoku Beach, 30 min before it starts security will guard the area and tell off people who are too close. Depending on wind they may rope off quite a bit of the beach. When the show starts you will be glad they did lol. Also beware of falling ash and debris. Stay safe.

Excellent, intense, brief fireworks! The hotel says it is at 7:45 but that is only the suggested time that you get there. The viewing location near the cantina gets full of beach blankets, so that is right. The prime viewing is along the orange cones blocking off the end of the Rainbow Tower, which prevents inconsiderate oafs from standing when the show starts and blocking your photo-taking.
.
The fireworks are lit from the coned area, so you are quite close. That means a great show, but it also means it is loud and you feel the concussion when the rockets launch and explode. It's like the subwoofer you wish you could afford! It could also frighten children, so please consider that.
.
The show lasted 4 minutes in our experience, beginning at 8:06. That was plenty of time to enjoy the excellent variety of shells and effects. The whole of the experience is wonderful and a must-do if you stay at the village.
.
Be aware that when it is over, the crowd jams the departure routes. Be patient, and make your way over to the WikiWiki store for shave ice. That's an exclamation point on the evening.
Short but good show. They were not super high end fireworks shot higher into the air, but was dull fun for a free show.

I suspect this could be a really good display, but like everyone else who crammed on to Waikiki beach tonight I missed it.  It's at the next beach down.  At the Hilton Lagoon, get yourself to Kahanamoku Beach!
Experienced great memories for my family

name: Makapu'u Tide Pools
address: Makapuʻu Point Lighthouse Trail, Waimanalo, HI 96795, USA
reviews: Great beach on a sunny day for body boarding or flying a kite. The water is a bit rough on the northern side of the beach but makes for great body boarding. There are several very nice tide pools to wade in (about knee deep) and you have a decent chance at seeing a few sea turtles swimming around near the pools. Definitely in my top 10 beaches to visit.
This place was cool! Awesome to see the sea cucumber and crabs loving in the low tide areas. Just be careful to not slip on the rocks, move slow so not to step on creatures!
The tide pools are beautiful with incredibly Clearwater to be able to see small fish fry along with baby crabs. Walking along the lava you should be careful
Nice little tide pools to explore with kids. Right next to Sea Life and makes a good stop. Sometimes good surfers to watch from here. We saw fish and crabs.

Beautiful and peaceful spot to visit however the climb down and up is dangerous. I don’t recommend taking children or dogs with you because it’s a steep and, in places, slippery route. Also, be aware in the tide pools there is marine life, namely, sea urchins situated in between slippery rocks. It’s easy to unintentionally harm marine life or yourself. Otherwise, a natural gift to enjoy.

name: China Walls
reviews: Great place to jump off the cliff into the ocean and great place to watch the sunset.  Kinda a younger crowd vibe and usually some music playing.  Easy access from the street.  Make sure to respect private property
Cool view! Do not jump in the water unless you're a good swimmer though! On a rough day, prepare to spend a good bit of time swimming against the current to climb out.

Cool spot to stop by if in the area. Street parking was plentiful but I’m sure it can get busy at times so I’d stick to going on weekdays. Locals were jumping into ocean from cliffs but unless your a strong swimmer I’d avoid it. Great place for picture taking.

Beautiful (no longer) hidden gem. Must park on one of the side streets before turning down and walking to end of street with dirt path leading to rock face. Easy walk along rock walls and can venture pretty far along coastline during the correct tide. Saw spear fishing and free divers as well as a brave solo snorkeler. Do not recommend snorkeling alone or without proper flotation / identification equipment as there were often fishing boats that came close to reef as well. Interesting view of Diamond Head. Many good spots for jumping off cliffs if timed correctly with waves and tide.
Good place if you like to jump into the ocean. Huge waves though so you need to be a good swimmer.

name: Room With A Clue
address: 1130 N Nimitz Hwy b295, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Our family has enjoyed Room With A Clue for a few years now. The staff is always helpful, the rooms are themes that intrigue and challenge all ages. We did "A Stranger Case" and LOVED the Stranger Things - like Theme.

This was one of the best rooms we have done. It was challenging and exciting, we have done over 30 rooms. Our game master was absolutely fantastic. Can't wait to go back and do more of their rooms. Highly recommend this escape room establishment.
It was a lot more fun than I expected! I definitely recommend that you try it out. We had a blast.
Friendly staff. Good rooms. Clean space. Hint: ask for clues little bit before needing them so they have time to type it out. Also small waiting area with some activites to play with.
It was fun and I had a great time. The game master was awesome! I would suggest this game room to everyone.

name: Kolowalu Park
address: 1240 Ala Moana Blvd, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews: This is one of the clean parks in town with fun children playground equipment. People generally is gentle and sweet when bring child/children here. Lots of space to run. around, close to big shopping mall and parking is usually great. One down side, no where to hide if it rains, and if it's a windy day, its EXTRA windy here because of all the high rise buildings around the park.
Nice little park in the middle of the city.  Great escape for kids 6 and under.

The park is nice. There's a decent playground and there are enough benches surrounding the playground so you can easily watch the little ones. The park also has a large grass area to have a picnic or run and play. Not a hilly park which is great to run around. The only problem is that there are no restrooms here. When the kids start to play, 10 minutes later someone has to go to the restroom. Other then that, the area is nice with shopping nearby in case you get an itch in the wallet.
I remember some great memory's from being here in the past and it was a great place to revisit
Nice fun park with large shaded field and play structure.

name: Maunakea Marketplace
reviews:
There was a nice variety of Asian foods. I got a one choice combo at one of the Pinoy vendors that hit the spot. ~$5 to be nice and full!

I definitely want to go back at a better time. I had gone right before closing. 

There’s also little shops for household items.

This is a place you want to wander in if you are visiting. Come in and check out the locals variety of produce and unique meats. You'll find great local restaurants around the market and as well as inside.

I had lunch at Tuk Tuk Cafe and tried their green curry. I thought that the price was a little high, but the portion size was good. Flavor was milder than I was expecting, not spicy at all. I would be willing to return and try other dishes.
cant go wrong with the $1 a bag veggies. be sure to wash the veggies good before cooking✌

Slightly improved from what it used to but still alot of homeless around.  Fewer food places in here to choose from and some of the better ones closed down. Still has the cheap eats even tho prices have gone up.

name: Lē'ahi Beach Park
address: 3187 Diamond Head Rd, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA
reviews: A very nice quaint Beach picturesque

Peacefully park with shade from trees. Beautiful views of palms, Diamondhead and the ocean. Only real downsides are that there is no place to buy a refreshment, no bathrooms, and occasionally some bums might hang out in the corner.

Great little park. I am a real big fan because there is no real parking, so it tends to remain fairly private to those that walk to it. Easy stair entry into in ocean, a short Sandy Beach front that drops fairly quick. Makes for a perfect miss run stop to soak in the ocean. Open from 5am to 10pm. And a beautiful tree pergola to rest under!

The one thing there is no really a beach to begin with... Mostly chopped-up coral dead reef rock sand and a mixture of green sea turtle shells... Joking about the sea turtles... And homeless people easy access to park facilities hence bathrooms and freshwater showers that are publicly used by anyone ... including temporary wannabes yes I'm talking about tourists!
Great place for a relaxing picnic watching the  sun go down.

name: The Honolulu Museum of Art Spalding House
address: 2411 Makiki Heights Dr, Honolulu, HI 96822, USA
reviews: A beautiful museum located on the top of Makiki. The views are stunning and the artwork here is great as well.  When you’re here, it feels like you’re in another world because you’re surrounded by nature and lush greenery. It’s $10 to get in with a local id other wise it’s $20, but I do think it’s worth a visit.

Didn't go into the museum. You can go to the cafe without paying the entry fee. The cafe is cozy. What I had was so-so. Service is good. 

The grounds are beautiful. We walked around part of the property after lunch and it's very lush as well as peaceful and serene.  I enjoyed spending some time there very much.

Great location for a quick picnic in the “country” and seeing the city spread out before you. The outdoor space has usually outshined most the the art exhibits (tough act to best). 

Now closed and on the market. We will see who buys this fabulous white elephant and then donates it back to HoMA again. Might make a great embassy site (one that does not need a lot of foot traffic).

Our favorite weekend spot. Love getting a picnic from the case and eating it out on the lawn under the huge tree. The grounds are super fun for kids - easy jungle climbing paths and lots of space for them to run around. Inside had a small but nice at collection.
Peaceful retreat high above the busy metropolis. Enjoyed the fresh air and art exhibits. Lush landscapes with beautiful native plants.

name: Waikiki Marine Life Conservation District
reviews:
I absolutely love the Waikiki marine life conservation. There is so much to learn about fish, coral and Hawaii! Very family friendly, I brought tons of family members. They love it if you're in the military so bring your ID to get discounts. Young kids get in free too.
I loved how they give wheelchairs to visitors that need them. My grandmother and her friend both couldn't walk the distance so we pushed them in a wheelchair. My sister had her own wheelchair, luckily the whole place was handicapped accessible. There was lots of room to fit 3 wheelchairs and my whole family and everyone else visiting.
My favorite thing was seeing all the amazing fish!
Some of it is out doors so prepare for that and... Enjoy!

Great place to take kids. Our 3 year old was very entertained by this. It's reasonably priced to get in, a fair bit to see. We spent about 2 hours here. There is free sunscreen available for the outdoor portions. The large fish and shark are fed around 11am, so that's a cool thing to see if the timing works out. There is also a small pond in the back for kids to touch and feel some shells and the like.
A fun little stop. I've been to much bigger aquariums but this one still had a few surprises in store. Some fishes here were totally new to me. The staff were lovely to chat with.

I love going to this aquarium. Lots of things to see and do. There is also a audio tower there. I love this place so much that I just want to come every time we come here. Love this place so much. There are things inside to look at and things outside to look at. I’d say this is the best aquarium ever because it is pretty big. I think that aquarium is the biggest aquarium I have gone it yet. Recommend mond for a attraction. Go there now if you love a good attraction. It is a good place if you live (or stay) in Waikiki. Best place ever! :)
The best Aquarium I've been to. Tanks are very clean and well maintained. A lot of very interesting critters.

name: Senia
address: 75 N King St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Started by ex-chefs of one of the worlds most famous restaurants in NYC, Per Se. We ate at the chef’s table and ordered the wine pairings which I absolutely recommend. The sommelier, Mike, picks outstanding wines and makes it a very special experience. I woke up the next morning still thinking about how special each course was. The service was truly exceptional. I am so happy we were fortunate enough to eat here while visiting Oahu!

Exceptional taste and presentation, and great service. Charred cabbage is an amazing dish with great texture, definitely a standout. The triple smoked salmon has been smoked with unique methods that make it not salty at all, which usually turns me off of smoked salmon. It was well presented and the accompaniments were well balanced flavor and texture wise. Very reasonable prices for dine dining, felt like a downright steal, especially for Honolulu. Make sure you reserve a few days in advance.

Best experience you can find at Senia is at the Chef's Table. Chef Anthony prepared a menu that is simply amazing. Make sure you reserve your spot now. From the staff, kitchen, and the food, everything was perfect. Simple as that.
One of the best kept secrets in Hawaii! Take your loved ones and your taste buds. You won't be disappointed!

A beautifully executed, no bs, quality-focused experience. There is nothing that could've been improved: the food quality, the service, the wine selection. We went with the chef's tasting menu, and we loved every single course. Everything was done well, presented well, and just complemented each other. Excellent meal.

name: Helena's Hawaiian Food
address: 1240 N School St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews:
Letting you all know up front, this place only takes cash, so come prepared. There's also no ATM on site, so you're walking a block or so if all you're carrying is plastic.

Parking wasn't as bad as some let on, and seating wasn't an issue either. We visited on a Wednesday evening, so maybe that's the key.

I got the kalua and ribs, both of which were awesome. I didn't try the poi, but the guys I was with (who had never had it) said it wasn't bad. It's definitely got to be an acquired taste kinda thing, but if it's your thing, I'm guessing this poi would deliver. I'm not native to Hawaii, but even I could tell the food was pretty authentic. The flavors were simple but rich. Really good food overall.

Service was awesome, and our server was very personable. They went over the menu with us, and let us know what was up with the condiments. 

The place itself isn't sexy, and the building is pretty much a hole in the wall. That being said, these kinds of places typically deliver, and this one is no exception. They have been doing this a while (since the 40's or so), and it shows in the food. So long as that's the case, I can forgo the fancy decor.

This is a must visit if you are in the neighborhood.  Came early and had one of the first tables for lunch/breakfast.  Recommend trying everything at this place as the plates are all family style.  The staff is all wonderful and you will have an authentic experience in here.

It was good. It was not mind blowing. They won a James Beard award, which is no joke. But it was 24 years ago, so things may have changed a bit. The short ribs and kalua pork were the best part. The lomi salmon was quite fishy, but I guess what you expect from fish that isn't local. Over all, worth a visit. But don't expect to taste the best thing you ever tasted.

The short ribs were my favorite by far, but the pulled pork and coconut custard dessert were also amazing. The staff was very friendly and the food came out extremely fast even though they were pretty busy. They are cash only so come prepared.

Helena's provided us with great customer service and a very entertaining dining experience. We visited this place off the recommendation of Matt The Traveler on YouTube and it was exactly what he said it would be! We were able to enjoy the true authentic Hawaii food experience. The food was flavorful and we are glad we got the chance to experience it.

name: Tommy Bahama Restaurant, Bar & Store
reviews: Excellent food and excellent service. The tortilla soup was amazing and the blackened mahimahi fish tacos were the best fish tacos I've ever had. The added touch of rooftop dining makes it that much.more appealing. Live music was great, too. Very reasonably  priced for the quality and presentation of the food as.well as the great service. I couldn't have asked for a better first dinner on Oahu.

I came her for my birthday dinner with my wife and 9 month old.  This place has 2 levels, with the top level being more open aired where you can feel the wind rip right through your toupee.  The food was top quality and very tasty. My wife and I got fish as part of our main course, but we ordered too much food and were full way too soon.  But that's how you live when you travel to Waikiki. The service was top notch and friendly.  I would definitely go back the next time I'm there.
Fun place and must visit. Incredible service. Food was great.  A group of 7 and we all talked about it the next day. 2 thumbs up

Amazing stop by on our way to the beach front for drinks. Atmosphere was very relaxed and service was phenomenal. Very comfy furniture and a nice view on any floor. They have a bar on both floors and everyone was prompt in our drink orders. I got the typical Long Board which was cold and fresh! The mai Tai's were mixed well and a good refresher as well. The wine and beverage selection is very extensive and appealing to all taste and pallets. Highly recommend as a good lunch/dinner spot, especially if your heading to and from the beach.
The best mahi mahi! Truly one of the best meals of my life. I loved the views from the rooftop (very romantic) and the service was excellent. Thank you

name: Roy's Waikiki
address: Next to Embassy Suites, 226 Lewers St, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA
reviews: I came here with my family several years ago. We ordered quite a bit of food; appetizers, sushi, drinks, entrees and desserts. Everything was delicious and the waiter was one of the best I've ever had. He knew everything about the menu, timed everything perfectly and was very professional. Perfection. I visited again two summers ago while on vacation with my girlfriend. Still amazing. Can't wait to come back.

I've never felt more welcomed to a restaurant in my life when dining here. Every employee greeted me and my date on our way in and bid us farewell as we left. The food was worth every penny spent and their pineapple upside down cake is incredible. The wait staff were also very responsive and quick.  I would absolutely recommend this place if you are looking for a more casual fine dining experience.

Busy, high turnover restaurant. Were seated promptly at our reservation time. I would recommend having a reservation, BTW. Our server was friendly and informative. The drinks were well executed. Food was above average, but executed within the price range. The only negative was that our table seemed a little cramped. Recommended!

Attended with a large group.  Easy walk from most places in Waikiki. Chef prepares fish dishes wonderfully, have not tried other entrees. Spellbound Merlot made a nice pairing.  Wait staff easily kept up with our group.  Dining room fills up, so reservations a good idea.  Try their Mai Tai at their bar on the corner, very tasty.

One of the best meals and service experiences I've ever had! The appetizer canoe for two is a must and all three of the fish dishes in the beach trio we're delicious. The food is great, but the phenomenal service is what made our experience worth the price!

name: Alan Wong's Honolulu
address: 1857 S King St, Honolulu, HI 96826, USA
reviews:
My sister and I joined my best friend and his partner for a valentine's dinner here. 
They have a special menu set for valentine's and the food, pictures I've added, were delicious. It cost $105 for the dinner and $155 to add wine pairing which was perfect.
The service by Mike was amazing - he's attentive, easy to talk to and funny.
There is valet parking so you don't have to fuss. However,  it costs $7 😆 🙄

Favorite splurge restaurant in Honolulu. Always great food and impeccable service (without being snooty).  Elegant enough to be a perfect anniversary date, but accommodating enough to have small children.  I always get the short ribs, which are super tender and flavorful.  My wife recently got the salmon risotto, which was perfect.  Don't miss the haupia coconut dessert, if you're not already stuffed!

The best place I have ever eaten to in Oahu! The restaurant itself decoration is not up-skill but it feels nice and a little fancy. The service was great, the waitress was nice and friendly, very careful of our needs and questions. I ordered a cocktail Mr Guava Lava to start. It was delicious and I could not taste the alcohol at all. Very dangerous ;)

The food is exceptional,  extremely creative. The server was attentive and knowledgeable.  Very good bread rolls are brought around with regularity. My only criticism would be the drink I had. I ordered Beefeater's gin in the rocks. They didn't have any and the drink that did come was stingy--one ounce of gin. It was the only disappointment this Midwesterner had.

Alan Wong's is Hawaiian fine dining at its best. If you're in the mood for a classier setting away from the casual Waikiki beach vibes, make the trek here. When you pull up to the building, don't be confused if you just see a regular office building. An elevator will take you up to the restaurant.

name: Lucky Belly
address: 50 N Hotel St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Great restaurant! Good atmosphere. Fairly small. We had a reservation and still had to wait a bit to be seated. The food was delicious. Little bit on the expensive side but worth it. Drinks are small, probably not worth the price.

Decided to go to Lucky Belly without reservations on a busy night and they were able to accommodate us at the bar. The creative dishes, and everything we ordered was off the charts good! The service is equally amazing. Love this place.

Been here twice and this place never disappoints me. The ramen was delicious and the salmon needed a bit more flavor but that lobster loco moco, I think that’s what it’s called, it is a must try here. The service is good and fast and the hibiscus lemonade was delicious.

SO. GOOD. 
I wish this restaurant could follow me around in life so I could eat their incredible food all the time. 
So so so good. The flavors were rich and perfect and the dishes also had a lightness to them... if that makes sense. I’d eat there weekly if I could!

The staff was AMAZING, very kind and attentive.  The food was top notch as well. Very tasty and everything was cooked to perfection. Portion sizes were great, and the enviornment was very comfortable.

name: Karai Crab
address: 1314 S King St STE G2, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews: Excellent food. Good service. Not fine dining, but delicious food. I had the mussels in Karai sauce and Garlic noodles. Exquisite.  The lighting is a bit bright. Friendly staff.

This place was a little bit away from Waikiki Beach but not that far maybe 20 minutes walk. I wanted to go because I wanted to experience something more local unless mainstream like everything else on the Waikiki Beach strip. it was exactly what I was looking for absolutely epic food and more of a local experience. Highly recommend this place and I will definitely go back next time I am in Honolulu.

OK....Forget my first post, Soooo love the flavors. I'm back in the South with a low country boil...Great parking, service with a smile and THE SEAFOOD....a must visit and eat. I love the seasoning, my favorite place now.

Absolutely Delicious! The staff was personable with lots of Aloha. I live here and it's the best meal I've had only had 2 great dishes and this ranks #1. Sit outside the Botanical Garden is beautiful. What a jewel in my own backyard. I can walk here and will atleast once a week for dinner. The music was even enjoyable. Prices is affordable.

First of all, it's crab, so expect to pay a decent amount to eat here.  They have other things on the menu but the crab is the main attraction.  They season the crab legs and put your desired level of spice on it before they serve it to you.  When I went, they forgot to bring out my appetizer of calamari but they made up for it by bringing it to me later AND removing the cost from my bill.  If you're in the mood for crab, I would highly recommend this place.

name: House Without a Key
reviews: We did wait a while despite having a reservation but the staff at the front desk were professional and nice. We had the catch of the day and the short rib and both were actually great. The coconut shrimp was average though. Cocktails were nice. Live entertainment was fun and not too in your face. It's a fairly casual place and the prices are definitely high for the vibe, but I think everything is expensive in the area so not too bad comparatively.

Loved the atmosphere. Beautiful setting.  Amazing and accommodating staff.  I was not into the fish tacos so they comped that dish for me.  Chocolate cake was amazing. Great drinks.  I think the fish gave me food poisoning though.  I was up all night. 😔

Tropical paradise outdoor venue.  Perfect for tasty meal or for a tropical drink prior to having dinner next door.  Evening are graced with live Hawaiian musician with a back drop of the ocean.  Orchids blossom everywhere.
Wonderful sunset view. Please take time to visit for a romantic dinner. Slow paced, great plates. Stiff drinks! One of the most romantic meals we had while on Oahu.

Thankfully we had reservations before sunset, this is imperative!! We requested a table to see the sunset and they gave us the best seat in the house, at least it seemed like it. Food was great, service was great, entertainment was even better.  What a awesome music and hula show!  We will be back every time we visit HI in the future

name: Koko Head Cafe
reviews: What a great place!!!  Staff is always friendly and full of aloha.  Food is off the charts delicious and served fresh and fast.  You may have to wait to get in but it is ALWAYS worth it!  Remember, breakfast only.  We always go early then hit a hike.  Perfect fuel to start an awesome Hawaiian day.

Worth the wait! We got there shortly after 8am and we had to wait about 45 min for a table for 2, but the food and service was worth the wait. Their dumplings were amazing! The pork and onion omelet was fluffy and very flavorful, and the breakfast bibimbap was really good as well. The service was spot on with friendly servers who also made great recommendations. Would definitely recommend!

The mix of flavors is something I could not have dreamed up but definitely created a party in my mouth! We arrived early morning to beat the crowd and found two seats at the bar. The tables filled up quickly by 9am. Food is fantastic and the service is friendly and entertaining. Highly recommend checking this place out.

Best breakfast we had in Honolulu! Amazing, prompt service and tons of amazing flavour. Would highly recommend. They don’t take reservations but the line moves pretty quick. Lots of innovative daily chalk board specials too.

Our waiter was so nice! In the middle of the brunch rush, he was able to accommodate a gluten intolerance and ensure that I wouldn't have any bubble guts after the meal. I couldn't appreciate it enough! The food was good. A little bit of a wait (~25 mins) but not bad.

name: The Original Roy's in Hawaii Kai
reviews: During this time of COVID-19 it’s been challenging for everyone to hunker down and stay at home. Roy’s has been making great efforts to put together delicious individual and large family meals. Easy to call in, select a pick up time, & then park and walk up to the window to pick up. So easy, you don’t have to cook, and at such reasonable prices! They have daily and weekend specials and a select to go menu to order from. They even make drinks to go! Support local!

Roys in Hawaii Kai is a great, family friendly, upscale restaurant where you can experience Asian Fusion and other classic dishes.  My son opted for the filet mignon and the server gladly accommodated his request for buttered pasta on the side rather fingerling potatoes that usually come with the meal.  We chose to sit outside where the views of the east coastline were breathtaking.  The upstairs dining area has the same views with a more intimate setting.  The meal ended with the chocolate souffle with the molten center, a must have...and a scoop of vanilla ice cream on the side for good measure.

It's our go-to place for friends and family celebration. Very familiar with the menu and the taste remains the same all these years. We've hosted from birthdays to grad parties and it's always been a great experience with them.

I frequent this place but tonight’s review is about the Wednesday night Wine night. First off all wines are 50 percent off the bottle. I was comparing prices and at that rate it brings some bottles down to the cost you can get them outside. 

Take a look at there happy hour menu and you will find plenty to delight your taste buds with. I went with the sampler this time since I wanted to save room for dessert. 

Remember to order ahead of time .... takes 20 mins, but the soufflé is amazing. Once in a while they change it up to the season so it won’t be just chocolate. I’ve had pumpkin, strawberry, matcha, chocolate and a couple others over the years.

We had a great experience at Roy's. They knew we had a young one with us, (6) so they brought us a plate of pasta and something to color on right away. Not that they had to, but it made the rest of the night go smoothly. We had sushi, cocktails, wine, steak, fish, and shelf fish; all of which I would have again! Can't go wrong, everything was amazing! And get the chocolate souffle, it's worth the wait!

name: Livestock Tavern
address: 49 N Hotel St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Trendy and stylish casual eatery. Excellent food and service. Great menu - modern American food. The gnocchi was excellent, as was the octopus (so tender), and the pork fillet was fantastic. And don’t skip the cornbread with jalapeño butter - it’s amazing!

Found this place on a list of top 50 places in Oahu.  It’s unsuspecting exterior and location nestled in “china town” just a few blocks from the Walmart were a bit surprising.  What was the most surprising, IN ALL THE BEST WAYS, was the quality of the food, the dedicated service, and the ambiance!  This place is a gold mine.  We made reservations same day without issue.  Inside has a ton of bar seating and the dining area hosts 20 or so tables.  Particular for bourbon with their bar, the drinks were delicious and the bar is stocked with a great variety.  The menu is meat based so it’s not vegan 🌱 or veggie friendly.  Think you could gather that from the name 🙄 but they have a few salad options and a Brie sourdough appetizer that was delicious.  I ordered the roasted chicken entree and it was the best meal I’ve had in a long time.  My other half ordered the prime rib, and the boy from Texas said it’s one of the best he’s ever had!  Highly recommend and will return again.

Lovely place for celebrations of flavors, drinks, and friends. Their bone marrow with escargot was an experience I have been longing for since. Escargot was great, bone marrow was perfect, but the cheese melt above it all took away from the dish. Maybe lighter cheese may have helped but it definitely was not necessary. The cheese cooled off quickly over the escargot on bone marrow which was off-putting aesthetically and to other flavors. We ordered a variety of dishes which were otherwise satisfactory.

A new concept in dining to hit Honolulu that others need to follow. We were at once transported to a Seattle or Portland type of eatery experience and were amazed by the innovative menu and cozy interior of this restaurant. Service was fast, friendly and efficient. No waiting for drink orders, course items were brought perfectly timed...not too fast and not too slow. A highly recommended dining experience for anyone venturing into the dark reaches of Honolulu Chinatown

Well this is an unexpected gem way off the tourist path in Honolulu. The food was amazing. The service was impeccable. We will return when we get back to Honolulu for sure.
Neighborhood and parking oddities aside, this is a 5 star restaurant with a great eclectic menu. 
What, buffalo corn dogs? Um Yeah, Awesome! 
Smoked Prime Rib was outstanding too!

name: La Mer
reviews: This is one of the most beautiful Restaurants I have ever been to. Our table was right in front of the ocean, service was Superb! Food was SUPERB! I mean you will not regret it. You must definitely go and have dinner here!

By far the best service and finest restaurant in Honolulu. Treated like royalty from the moment you arrive and the food is superb. I proposed at La Mer 15 years ago and they accommodated my every need. Now we have returned 15 years later for our anniversary and the experience was just as memorable. A beautiful setting and wonderful service. The best restaurant experience possible anywhere in the world.

A culinary delight! The service is impeccable and attentive without being intrusive.   We felt like we were the only guests and each of our three courses were simply fabulous.  What a delightful fine dining experience!

There is a reason this restaurant is considered one of the top restaurants in Waikiki. Firstly from the moment we arrived we treated like Royalty and given the best table in the restaurant- table 25 looking over the ocean. Service was friendly, knowledgeable but not intrusive. The food was simply outstanding. Beyond the food we look at the overall experience and can honestly say this was a truly a memorable experience. We were never rushed. The waiter’s recommendations were spot on and the sommelier added some valuable insight on wines and cognacs.

This was a special evening at a special venue. We had an amazing dinner set atop the Hawaiian waves brushing the Waikiki shore. The Halekulani is special to begin with. Place a French restaurant on top of the shore with windows looking out onto the beach and you have the set up for an AMAZING restaurant. To start it off, the service was on par with THREE STAR MICHELIN restaurants. Our waiter (Chuck?) was a local who had been there for years and was the best. No lack of timing in this place where each dish is served impeccably timed after the next. The food is on par with the best restaurants in the world. Why they have not been lauded elsewhere is beyond me. We had an amazing evening and would recommend the experience to anyone else traveling in the area. They bring true high class standards to the islands while still making you feel like your on island time (without sacrificing the wait)!

name: Orchids
reviews: We have just finished a birthday dinner for my wife. Jason was our waiter and was absolutely amazing. The food was so so good. We had the chefs tasting platter and it was next level great. We got engaged here is 2018 had our wedding reception dinner here in 2019 and now my wife's  birthday.  To some this up wow,wow,wow. This is one of our special memory places.

The most amazing fancy brunch buffet. It’s expensive, but the atmosphere, service and seafood buffet section is worth it. This was my mom’s favourite meal during our visit to Hawaii and as people who like to eat, that’s high marks. Prime rib, poke of all kinds, luau pig, killer desserts. We had a prime covered outdoor table overlooking Diamond Head.

Top notch service and food! Eric was our server and he was very professional and personable. Although we were not staying at the Halekulani, it appeared to be a beautiful hotel on the beach of Waikiki. The food was superb and we will definitely return!
What a beautiful restaurant for a special occasion. The staff, food and ambience is amazing. Daniel was an exceptional waiter and couldn't ask for a better service.

The service was excellent but the food was only mediocre given the price.
It was very empty even at dinner time.
The lounge nearby seemed a lot more lively with live music.

name: The Pig and The Lady
address: 83 N King St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Wonderful place! Was seated pretty quickly for not having a reservation, but can definitely see this place being very popular most nights. The food is wonderful. Got the pork ragu tagliatelle and was amazed. Was able to try some of my friend's foods and highly enjoyed those as well. They also have some pretty crazy drinks too! Also shared the P&L sundae swirl and enjoyed it. Definitely recommend!

Fried chicken was really good! Juicy and full of flavor. Spring roll are fresh and tasty.
Only the roast fish kind of stinky. You know you really didn’t do well when Chinese people can’t eat that food.
But service here is awesome, fast and friendly.

Food was good, I ordered the chicken salad vermicelli bowl while my fiance ordered the pho beef dip. Service was really good, the bathroom was definitely a cool atmosphere. The fiancee and I enjoyed each  flavour, but the brisket he had gotten was a bit more on the drier side. Will recommend to any future family and friends going to visit Honolulu.

I love the fact the waiters/servers not only hand you menus, but they also make recommendations and tell you what the specials are for the day. It's not only comfy and cozy, but also very trendy and modern. I love the set up of this place and the semi-open commercial like kitchen... the decor is beautiful. My coworkers really enjoyed the wings and the calamansi slushies. I simply loved the garlic noodles with crispy pork belly! The garlic noodles with the pork belly was so savory and delicious. Definitely recommend.

Love this place, food is sensational. I sometimes get upset because they change the menu often to keep it fresh and then I fall in love with some new item. And do NOT forget to save room for a soft serve, they are out of this world,

name: Side Street Inn
reviews: Easily accommodated our party of 8 at one of many large tables.  Family style portions mean you WILL be full when you are done.  Don't eat too much because desert is equally excellent to the main courses.  Don't sweat the location/ally this great place is in.  A very welcoming restaurant and staff made this our best Honolulu dining experience.  shockingly affordable.  Dinner for a table of 8 with 3 deserts and adult beverages for all 8 was $200
The locals here are so warm and welcoming. I recommend the Kim Chi fried rice and the garlic fried chicken. Absolutely delicious. Call for reservations because they get busy quick.
Had dinner here with friends from Fiji and Guam. Loved the food! Manila clams, pork chop, vegetable salad. big sized serving. Must try if you are in Honolulu.
Family style sharing of food. Best with party of 3 or more due to quantity if food served. Fried pork chops are the best along with their fried rice
Fantastic food place. Extremely highly recommended.

name: Sweet E's Café
reviews: This place is so amazing. All the dishes are very delicious. You must try one of the many scrumptious omelets. The breakfast burritos are in sanely good I had one today. We also had the Belgian waffle with fruit so tasty. We had a delicious refreshing salad made with fresh local style greens. And we also had a side order of their amazing fried rice. They are very efficient and the wait is not long at all even though there's a lot of people outside.  Needless to say I highly recommend sweet e's for your breakfast cravings.

From the outside the place looks like a dive but don't let this fool you.  The inside and bathrooms are very clean.  The food is amazing.  They were the best meals we had in all of Hawaii.  You can tell that there is care put in to the prep and cooking.  The staff is fast and very friendly.  6 stars if i could.

I went here on a Sunday morning and was extremely pleased. They have a valet service upon arrival and a waiting area. I had to wait maybe a half hour but it was well worth it. This place is a smaller more local type restaurant, but the food does not disappoint. They are very generous with their servings and the pancakes here are some of the softest and fluffiest I have come across. They can probably be cut with a spoon. Overall food and service was great. I will be going again for sure.

First time here but saw the star rating. Been on the hunt for a good eggs Benedict. Waiters very attentive. 
Food A+. Super stoked I found this. Super busy Friday morning. Parking a little tight so look to the street. Place is awesome sauce

First time here at this restaurant and it was amazing!! Seating areas inside and outside for dining. Food is great and plenty to choose from. Bathrooms...cleanest restrooms I have ever been in. Parking is like any place, limited and hard to find. 
Overall Sweet E's Café is now on the GOTO place to eat, especially for breakfast

name: Uncle's Fish Market & Grill
address: 1135 N Nimitz Hwy, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Tasty food, lovely setting, excellent service, live acoustic music, generous portions, diverse menu, good iced tea! Neat find on the water, one of the intriguing dining choices at Pier 38. We were asked if we had reservations, we didn't, and were seated within about 10 minutes. Appeared to be many seats available,  so maybe they get hopping a bit later. Reservations are easy enough to make, so consider doing so. Also, spacious main dining room and a quieter room off to the side for more private meals. We enjoyed the back room seating and had very attentive service. Beautiful setting for a walk by the water after dinner. Overall, we found Uncle's to be quite a pleasing experience, and think you will, too.
Truly an incredible dining experience. We had the combo sashimi and ahi belly. It was an unrivaled experience, and I am grateful we had the opportunity to finally go!

Came here for dinner and definitely got what we were looking for!! The place itself and decorations is pretty awesome especially if your a fishermen!! Very nicely decorated, we got the catch up the day (I forgot the fish name) that was delicious!! And also got the poke trio, thought it was a smaller place when ordering and boy was I wrong (picture does seem like a lot but it really is! 3 VERY good portions of the most amazing poke I have ever had! I have eaten a lot of diffident poke and this place is by far the freshest/best tasting I’ve had!!
We had the Uncle Combo platter. Best calamari steak I have ever eaten. Fish and shrimp were so fresh. Cole slaw better than I make at home. Staff is so friendly and happy. You must try this place.

So we are in Hawaii for a big family trip. This place was highly recommended. The food was very good. The clam chowder quite possibly the creamiest with large clam chunks ive ever had. All of the fish was fresh. Waiter did his best to accommodate our party of 15, and only a few things kept it from being 5 star.

name: Chef Chai
reviews: Took the girlfriend here for Valentine's Day. Firstly, the presentation of the food was immaculate. Secondly, the taste of the food was immaculate. Thirdly, the cost of the food seemed to be worth-while if you're a foody and are willing to pay for presentation. The staff was also great and responsive to requests. I'd highly recommend this place for a nice date or an important meeting. The alcohol selection was also decent and they had plenty of wines to pair with your meal.

We recently were here for Valentine's day. The menu was prix fixe so there weren't as many choices as usual. The appetizer was very impressive. The ahi tartare and the oysters were my favorite. The entree was good. They cooked the steak to a perfect medium rare and the sauce was tasty.

The desserts were the star of the meal. The white chocolate truffle and raspberry/guava sauce was out of this world.

When in Honolulu again, I will revisit to give the standard menu a shot and see if they still have that dessert.
Amazing food! I ordered the vegetarian menu set and it did not disappoint! Even my daughter loved her appetizer sampler and she's six!
The best dinning  experience I have had in a long time. I had the lamb chops in a brandy sauce and it was awesome.  The sevice was perfect.

Had a great experience celebrating my wife's birthday. The food was fantastic in taste and artful presentation. Very cool street art around. Waiter helped me surprise my wife with a jewelry gift at desert. Also the duck taco's are fantastic. No misses on taste, quality, presentation, or service.

name: Azure
reviews: We had an absolutely fantastic evening at the Azure. I took the five-course Prix Fixe Menu, which was excellent. The location and atmosphere are just great.

This was our first experience at Azure and we were very impressed. The restaurant is within the stately Royal Hawaiian Hotel on Waikiki Beach overlooking Diamond Head. We opted for the 5 course treating menu and every dish was extremely creatively presented and the flavors were sublime. Although it was a "tasting" menu, we were more than content when dinner was complete. Raymond was an outstanding server: very professional and affable. I also enjoyed the pacing of the dinner; unrushed, with ample time to enjoy every dish. This was a superb experience and we look forward to returning in the future!

The ambience and presentation of food was amazing.  The waiter was very attentive and friendly.  The only thing was that although the food tasted good the food started getting really salty as we got closer to the bottom of the dish.   The part not in the sauce was very delicious.
wonderful.  The view is awesome.  Exquisite food and 10 star service.  I recommend it 1000%
Service was very friendly & attentive. 5*. Sunset view can't be beat. My scallops & ahi tuna was excellent. The mixed greens salad was a large portion & very tasty. $$$$

name: Hy's Steak House
reviews: Best lamb chops ever. Caesar salad is unmatched by anyone. Best also is the escargot. I have eaten there many times over the years and it's always been great experience. Recommended to anyone. A little pricey but worth it.

Awesome awesome food.  Steaks, rack of lamb, lobster tail, and king crab legs were the best! The desserts were excellent.  Bananas Foster is still our ultimate favorite. Capt Brett and the crew were super excellent.  They were entertaining and funny. Can't ask for anything more!  $$$ but worth every penny.

AMAZING! From the minute we entered, we were in awe! From the service to the meal, everything exceeded our expectations. This is a MUST for those who have want fine dining, great food, and excellent service. And KIRBY is a great addition to the fabulous team. We will definitely return.❤️❤️🌺🌺

Found this place just by walking by and went im for a quick meal not thinking much if it. To our surprise it was one of the best places I've dined in Waikiki.  Food and service was amazing.  Not cheap but well worth a steak there or anything on there menu everything was delicious with good old fashioned service. .

Can’t go wrong with Hy’s and their Waikiki branch did not disappoint! From drinks in the bar to dinner in the dining room, everything was old school charm & elegance and the food was excellent. The Prime rib was some of the best I’ve ever had - seasoned well and cooked to medium rare perfection. We unfortunately didn’t have room for dessert but the bananas fosters with ice cream looked (and smelled) divine.

name: Yard House - Takeout & Delivery Available
address: 226 Lewers St l148, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA
reviews: I can't tell which I love more. The beer or the food. I just got into drinking craft beer last year and let me tell you how excited I was to see all of the different beer taps. Sam 76 is hands down my favorite beer and they actually had it. There's something for everyone. If you never tried craft beer it doesn't hurt to try because the staff are extremely knowledgeable. More knowledgeable than I thought especially with the quantity of beers they had. I requested for a random flight of beers and each one was a perfect choice. The food was spectacular. Baked Mac and cheese appetizer was unlike something I've never tasted before. I went with 6 friends and tried each of their food and it was all of top quality. I would recommend this to anyone. This goes in my book of 6 stars

Amazing selection of beer, food was amazing. Love the lack of bright light. Got seated without waiting and my server was super friendly and helpful with the questions I had regarding the menu. Food came out quick and the appropriate temperature. Definitely will return often. We even had a free appetizer coupon that had expired and they allowed us to use it :)

I love dining  at this restaurant. The food is great and the beer selection is beyond amazing! The server was great.  He was quick to greet us to get our drinks. The food was perfect. It was cooked exactly like I wanted it and it was delicious. Will come back for more!

The first night we went to Yard House, we missed happy hour by 10-15 minutes. We asked our server if he would let it slide, and after talking to management, we got the happy hour specials on beer and appetizers. Our server, Fred (aka Jordan), was very friendly and gave us recommendations about things we should do on the island during our stay. I highly recommend the chicken nachos and boneless wings, both were some of the best plates we had while vacationing in Hawaii. The second time we visited Yard House, we were greeted by the waitress, who we had met during a hike the same day - what are the chances. She gave us dessert on the house. if I had it my way, I'd go to Yard House for apps and drinks every night.

Yard House is a Waikiki favorite of mine. Never fails. Guaranteed great food and drinks. it wasn't after a year of eating there that I realized that it was a chain restaurant. I never would have guessed. It's great because they're open really late as well. So if you come in on the late flight and you're staying in Waikiki I recommend this place. However it can be a bit loud.

name: Aloha Tortilla Factory & Cafe
address: 1 Aloha Tower Dr, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews: The best tacos I have had in a long time. They are made from scratch and you can tell. Just wonderful. A nice little salad came with it with a light dressing that we delicious. Nothing else comes close in Waikiki. Don’t not miss this little place, right under the Aloha Tower.

I got the beef, chicken and pork tacos and they were all fresh and amazing!! The gentleman I had the pleasure of placing my order with was so courteous and friendly... I will find out how to spell his name and update lol!  I really appreciate the friend who recommended I try it!! I will DEFINITELY be back!!

I have lived in Hawaii for a year now been to many restaurants but this is by far the best tacos I’ve had on this island. Owners are extremely nice and you can tell they care about your satisfaction. I will be coming back and often. Plus you can not beat the price !!!! 
Mahalo !!!

This was the best Mexican food I have had on this island!  You can tell that the food was prepared with love and a lot of precision.  I happened upon the place by chance.  I will definitely be back!  The service was wonderful.  They were welcoming and friendly.  The food was extremely delicious.  But on that note I would suggest to make two orders so that you have some to take with you.  The prices are very reasonable and I would recommend this place to anyone that likes Mexican food.  The carne asada is my fave hands down!  Make sure to get extra green salsa if you like spicy food!

This is truly authentic Mexican cuisine! I was leery at first with the simplicity of the ingredients but then heard the owner speak and knew it was going to be legit. I ordered the 5 carne asada tacos and a side of chips and salsa, my husband ordered the 5 pork tacos and a torta.  Right off the bat (since they were close to closing) I had my husband go grab another chips and salsa to go for my dessert later. The tacos were so genuine that I can say as I born and raised Cali resident and avid Mexico visitor and being half Mexican, that these were truly the closest thing to what the women of the churches down there used to make for us. Doubled up corn tortillas, simple ingredients, and perfectly proportioned. I'm not a huge torta eater but my husband adores them and made me divulge...and boy was it worth it! One of the best I've EVER had! Thank you for bringing legit tacos to our island finally!

name: MW Restaurant
reviews: I love MW. They were super accommodating to my allergy and let me know any dishes that had come in contact with my allergen/recommended against certain foods. The food is delicious, portion size is good—what you’d expect from a nice restaurant in this price range. The set menus are nice if you’re pretty hungry. The atmosphere was nice and the wait was a bit long without a reservation but I’d recommend going as long as you are okay with the wait, get there before the rush, or make a reservation.

Loved it. Did happy hour and lunch pre fixe. Our waiter was just an awesome server. Explained the menu in great detail and was excellent at service. Our food was terrific. The soup, fish dishes were all just superb. We enjoyed this as our last meal on this island. Amazing finish
Absolutely delicious amazing food. The dessert was fantastic. We had the 5 course tasting menu and loved the little sampler of different apps. Great place.

One of the best dining experiences I’ve ever had. Big kudos to the chefs and servers for amazing food and service. I would highly recommend the boa buns and the “fried chicken” as starters. Make sure to make a reservation well in advance for this 5 star restaurant!

Menu is limited if you have dietary issues (I don't eat certain meats), but the service is TOP NOTCH, and the food tastes delicious!!!! The strawberry pineapple soda (referred by our server) was so yummy, and The "shave ice" dessert was AMAZING. Seriously good.

name: Fête
address: 2 N Hotel St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: New American style restaurant in downtown in Hawaii. We did make a reservation but we had to wait to have a seat for 30 minutes or so as it was overbooked. That could have taken one star away but the quality of food is amazing so that I couldn’t take it. The staff is also nice and friendly so we did enjoy the good dinner. The restaurant looks so popular that the reservation is highly recommended. Also our reservation time was 8 pm but some plats were already out of stock, so early time might be better if you have something you want to have.

The server was wonderful.   The location is in china town and we went on a Sunday night which meant dodging human poo on the sidewalk to get there.

The cheese plate was good and the dipping sauces were good.  Totally overpriced though. 

I got the risotto with beef cheeks which tasted bland like a braised pot roast on a plain risotto base.  Almost no flavor which is weird since risotto is normally a sponge for flavors.

My wife got the gnocchi which seemed a little undercooked.  The gnocchi was extremely soft and borderline raw, however it could have been a loose batter since the ricotta cheese. 

Overall it's not worth the prices since you can buy a cheese plate anywhere else for less and the protein I got was bland as well as the starch. 

I dont think we will return, if we do its because the server was awesome and the ambiance was great since we were in the "library"

Great ambiance, however dishes are hit or miss. Appetizers & cocktails are fantastic, however the entrees are unspectacular and a bit run of the mill. Suggest hitting up this spot for starters and tasty drinks at the beginning of the night and another establishment with fantastic entrees elsewhere in downtown Honolulu for dinner. Service is great, very accommodating.
Really good food. The nicoise  salad is large and delicious. The deviled eggs are some of the best I've ever had. Happy hour is $3 off cocktails and the bloody Mary is amazing!
This is a cozy place, rather new, and shows signs of evolving into a quality restaurant. The special dishes off the menu are more imaginative and excellent.

name: La Mariana Sailing Club
address: 50 Sand Island Access Rd, Honolulu, HI 96819, USA
reviews: Great food, great service. We had the (double) burger, which was juicy and tasty, and the ribs, with their sweet and juicy taste. The Mai Tais were great, according to my wife, our little one enjoyed the linguine from the kids menu. Overall a pleasant stay, except for one bit of criticism: when asking for dessert, we were told they had some ice cream pie only. The table next to us, regular visitors, obviously, were offered with a variety of dessert just a couple of minutes later. Would still recommend, we liked the coziness of the restaurant.

Great atmosphere! Quite the awesome restaurant tucked away in a corner by the sailboats! Twice a week they have a singing percussion playing group that performs as you eat. Parking is free. Food tastes good- we got the kailua pork nachos and calamari (theirs looks more fish stick like- not quite what I expected, but still good). Wish we came to this spot earlier, it's a fun place to go and enjoy the scenery and relax

I can't rate the food because we never got any.
There seems to be an in crowd here that the staff all knows and caters to. And we weren't them.
There was a wait for a table, which is fine, but the staff missed open tables again and again. Literally, the people waiting were pointing out empty tables.
After about 25 minutes, we were seated. The server visited the table next to us no less than five times--she brought their food, a round of drinks, extra horseradish--and never so much as cast us a sideways glance. 20 minutes and we hadn't gotten water or the time of day.
A group was seated across from us--regulars. When the server brought then water, we walked out.
