Alena made our dining fun and memorable. The food was tasty as well. And the bartender did his job making excellent drinks. The female manager opened the store for us so we could buy shirts. Lots of tourists. The locals are missing out.

There are few places left in Honolulu that are free from the tourist masses and this is one of them.  Food was great, and the live music entertaining, but nestled at the end of an industrial section of the water front the ambiance wasn't as inviting as I'd have liked.  But you can't have it all. Would I go back? Yes, but with slightly lower expectations.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
address: Waterfront Plaza, 500 Ala Moana Blvd, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews: Now the best experience ever. We have eaten here for years. It is out "go to" place for the best steak, seafood, and service. We have NEVER been disappointed in Ruth Chris in the past 23 years, 8 locations, and 5 states until last night. It was busy and I get that, but they failed on so many points throughout the evening it is very hard to give them any slack as being a one off. The manager did his best to make up for everything. It is hard to believe that our old faithful had let us down on such a special night. We will think about it if we are going to go back again and try again.

Although it was very busy on Valentine's day, Victor was running around making sure we had everything we needed. Excellent service by Victor! 

Food was good and our server was good. Service was slow other than Victor's filling water, getting bread, and asking if we needed anything else. Ambiance is good. Great date night 🥂

The staff was very pleasant and courteous. Menu is similar to that on Mainland, which was great! My rib eye was not initially presented to me in the manner that I ordered it (Req for MW but it came out R) but our server immediately rectified it. Looking forward to our next wonderful experience @ Ruth Chris, Honolulu (Ala Moana location)

We went to Ruth Chris Steak House this evening for an office party. A Great location at Restaurant Row with lots of parking. It is located just outside of Waikiki. The food and service were excellent. The decor was upscale casual and very comfortable.
I highly recommend Ruth Chris Steak House for great food, good prices and convenient location with lots of parking.

The steak is always on point and the service is excellent ... they always make us feel so comfortable and relaxed.  They also have all our favorites for dessert.  Hard to not leave her feeling satisfied and at least 5 pounds heavier!

name: Da Ono Hawaiian Food
reviews: Good food but priced high compared to other local spots. I liked everything we tried other than the poi. It just wasn't my taste. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Stop by if you're in the area.
Service and experience we're top notch. A local buddy told me this is the best authentic Hawaiian food in the area; for that I had to try it. Glad I did.
Great authentic Hawaiian restaurant. If you want a true taste of Hawaii, this is a must!! Food was delicious and the service was fantastic!
Love the chicken long rice and laulau. Not as crowded as it used to be but the food seems to be the same to me so no complaints here.

This was good but I think it can be better. I got #1 & #4.. #1 lacked a bit of flavor, I liked number 4 better and it was pretty good. And I would say it is pretty fresh. Lack of stars is due to flavor and size, the amount you got for the price you payed was a bit much and I saw the guy next to me get a large and there was barely a difference.

name: Shokudo Japanese Restaurant & Bar
reviews:
Returned to Shokudo after a long hiatus and happy to see that the food & service are still top notch! Known for their Honey Toast & fresh seafood offerings with a casual, welcoming atmosphere Shokudo restaurant does not disappoint.

At my last visit our group was greeted at the front and seated almost immediately. Our server April was very sweet and while admitting that she was new, she already had some favorite items on the menu, the Homemade Tofu Salad & Red Eye Roll. We ordered both as well as a few other dishes on the menu. Both of her suggestions were fantastic! The tofu salad is not only delicious, it's also huge and was great to share for our party of three. The service was very attentive, April as well as another server, Alex, answered our questions on some unfamiliar items. Even though April didn't know the entire menu yet, she was happy to check with senior staff and came back with answers and a beaming smile :D When our meal was winding down one of the managers, Karlo, stopped by and suggested the famous Honey Toast for dessert. He joked that some meals both begin and end with Honey Toast, suffice to say, we were sold. I was especially happy to see that it was available with two of my favorite flavors of ice cream, Cookies n Cream, and Green Tea! We will definitely be back.
Wonderful happy hour. I love their housemade tofu and mochi gratin. Honey toast for dessert is a must.

I would’ve given this place 5 stars if it wasn’t because of the booths we were sat on. They looked old and overused, so this place probably need to upgrade a little bit. The food on the other side was delicious. We tried the pizza sushi or something like that and the baked lobster roll, I can’t really remember the names, but they were very tasty. The lychee refresher was also really good with boba. The service was good, our server I think he mentioned he wasn’t a server but was covering for someone else, he did a pretty good job and was always trying to help. I would recommend this place.

Took my friend here for her birthday. Everything was great. The waiter gave us a great recommendation for saki. The sushi were tasty. The mandoo was crispy and tasty too. The Honey toast is decent just for pics
Prompt and friendly service. Comfortable booths. Some of the menu items are a bit pricey, but worth it for the quality. I like that they offer a sake sampler. The bread pudding is to die for

name: Duke's Waikiki
reviews: Was recommended Dukes Waikiki for breakfast from my hotel staff. They offer a breakfast buffet for only $18.00. Everything I ate was delicious. They have made to order omelettes, chicken sausage links, Portuguese sausage, potatoes with vegetables, french toast, pancakes, oatmeal, fried rice and a spread of fresh fruit. I ate her 3 times while I was here and was never disappointed. The best part to me was the coconut syrup for the french toast. Delicious!

Whether here in Waikiki or at home in Huntington Beach, you can never go wrong with Duke's. Always great food deliciously prepared. Excellent quality fish and other options for those wanting something else. Lunch is easy and has a more middle road menu (but just as delicious) - dinner is a little more fine dining and here in Waikiki gets REALLY busy. Either have reservations or plan on waiting 1-2 hours! I had fish and chips today and it was awesome!

Excellent breakfast buffet, only $18. Coffee, water and/or tea included in price. Additional beverages available for purchase. Host was extremely welcoming and struck a conversation after calling our party. Wait time was no more than 10 minutes. Scrambled eggs are savory and cooked the way they should be, not like the hard rubber-like eggs served elsewhere. Omelets made to order. Lots of fruit, yogurt, and cereal choices. Fried rice and white rice available. Definitely planning to visit the Huntington Beach location in the near future.

The buffet at Dukes is fresh and fantastic. We have come here several times over the years and will keep coming back. The prime rib was perfectly cooked to my request. The atmosphere is classic Waikiki, the staff is extremely friendly and courteous and the live music drifting from table to table was a nice touch.

This place is crazy busy but worth the wait. We visited twice while vacationing in HI. Once as a family with a reservation and once as a couple with no reservation. There really isn't a bad table in this restaurant.  The table we had as a family faced the ocean and the deuce was in a small quiet dining area. The food was great, the wine list quality and accessible and the martinis nice and chill. The local fish was delicious, tender and flaky.

name: Kyung's Seafood Inc
address: 1269 S King St, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews: Always fun, always great food. Lots of street parking close by

And just wow!!!!  Love the small cafe feel and the big tasting food.  Everything is so fresh and so authentic.  

Fabulous food & atmosphere!  - call ahead for reservation

I like that they close at midnight. When I crave spicy ahi and everywhere else is close, this place is my go to. I usually order BBQ chicken and poke plate. Or meatjun and poke plate. They have good quality food and their customer service is good. Auntie is always so friendly to her customers. They have parking at the back. But when its full, they are surrounded by street parking. So parking wouldn't be a problem.
One of the most delightful meals we had on our Hawaii vacation! Inconspicuous, unpretentious locale. Easily the best Saba fish I've ever eaten.

I HIGHLY recommend this place! It you love Korean-style sushi, look no more. They give hearty portions and you won’t be disappointed. They have lots of options but I mainly got the sashimi plates because that’s why I went. The owner was super sweet and gave lots of side dishes for us to try as well.

name: Lam's Kitchen
address: 1152 Maunakea St # A, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Unbelievable find recommended my family members. Amazing dumplings and dishes. You can't order anything wrong! A must stop! ❤️
Solid taste and solid portion. You can't go wrong

What a great little place in Chinatown for a noodle fix. Here they specialize in rice and egg noodle dishes that are made in house. Came in with a group of 7 and got their beef flank & tendon mien (8.99$), wonton mien (8.25$), and beef choysum chow fun (8.99$) and it was delicious. The portion size is amazing and the flavors were spot on. We had an order of wonton on the side (8.00$) to add it to the beef noodle soup and it was excellent. The service was also great. The servers were patient and attentive. Gave them an extra tip because they were so nice. The restaurant is small so you might have to wait a bit before if you come in a large group.

Chinese comfort food at its finest! Service was fast and friendly. The atmosphere was inviting. Seating is minimal but turnover was fast. Parking may be an issue because it is in town. But, I will be going back a lot.
OMG ! Off the Hook.... Delish and Great Value!

name: Hula Grill Waikiki
address: 2335 Kalakaua Ave Office of Institutional Effectiveness, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA
reviews: My friends love this place and have been raving about it since I've met them, so I decided to tag along to try it out. I was not disappointed! First of all, the view was amazing. We on the patio with a view of Diamond Head and Waikiki beach. Secondly, the wait staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Lastly, the food was delicious! We got the ribs for an appetizer and I got the breakfast burrito. I will definitely be revisiting this place in the near future!

Fantastic restaurant with nice views on beach and ocean. The food here is fantastic, no matter what you like and order. I personally like the fish dishes, and all I've tried so far were delicious. Don't forget to try the hula pie (easily serves two people), it's fantastic. The service has always been very attentive and great when we've been here. I've experienced some waiting for a table, depending pob when you're here, but no longer than 10 to 25 minutes. You can place a reservation online, just to be sure. Every time we've been on Oahu, we came here and were never disappointed.

OUTSTANDING FOOD AND SERVICE

We were in the mood for seafood and were not disappointed. The menu offered several fish dishes along with a shrimp/pasta bowl. The very knowledgeable waiter described everything in great detail and his timing was spot-on. We were able to secure a prime table along the rail overlooking the beach due to the promise of the hostess, Bethany. Although somewhat noisy and hectic, a very memorable dining experience for us.

Wonderful gluten free chowder. But double check your menu has correct prices. If you get old lower prices menu, they will not fix them to what you thought you would pay when you were handed over a menu. So besically fairly typical Hawaii non existent customer service aka. "we don't care if you are back" attitude.

Perfect spot for a sunset dinner and a mai tai. Make sure you request a seat on the terrace and then sit back and enjoy the ocean views, live local music @ Duke’s and the lively activity on Waikiki Beach, all from an elevated position. 
Great friendly service, and good food. Loved the Calamari Steak, and the Mac Nut Shrimp! Make sure you order the hula pie to finish- to share. It’s so amazing. 
Live music and hula dancing in the bar area.

name: La Cucina Ristorante Italiano
reviews: Easily the very best Italian restaurant in the pacific! Such a treat in the middle of town away from the silliness that is Waikiki. The food is prepared per order from scratch...and it shows. The food is absolutely superb. The staff will tell you that there will be a wait for the food due to the impeccable preparation, but I've not once been displeased with the time it takes to receive incredible food. Another glass of wine never hurt the appetite anyway! The staff is friendly, attentive and jovial.  I cannot say enough great things about this place!

Everything we've tried on our visits here has been excellent. The cioppino is great, and my wife loved both the bolognese and the gnocchi. The atmosphere is cozy and romantic. The service was prompt, attentive, and friendly. The food is made fresh when you order and thus takes awhile to arrive, and without reservations expect a wait to be seated.
All food is made to order and is AMAZING!!!! You need at least a party of 4 to RSVP. The food is worth the wait. Definitely will be going back again.

Came here on a Thursday a bit before 530 and snagged a table. If you're a pasta lover, you definitely have to try this place! We ordered the Crostini Al Porcini and the Bone Marrow for appetizers. Those were delicious! Bone Marrow was salty but still really tasty. For the main, we got Trenette Norcina and Ravioli Neri. Norcina stole the show for me. Pasta was so good and fresh! Ravioli was also good but scarce. Would definitely come again. Main dishes took an hour to come out but it's worth it.
Great food, great service, just go already.

name: A Place to Eat
address: 1035 University Ave Ste 104, Honolulu, HI 96826, USA
reviews: Heard about this place through a travel guide. Was initially skeptical but the food and service were incredible. The no-frills, laid-back atmosphere made it feel like the place was dedicated just to us. Ribs were tender and cooked to perfection. Person I was dining with said the NY steak was one of the best he's ever had. Not even accounting for the low price, it's one of the best places to eat in Honolulu.

A hidden gem of Honolulu. No table service and you can bring your own cutlery, plates and alcohol if you want or grab to go, but the food is fantastic and the owner is super nice. Awesome steak for $12! Should be called, "A place to eat well for cheap!" Looking forward to trying the rest of the menu. Mahalo.
Super yummy super fresh. Very nice owner who was very accommodating! Thanks for making our New Year’s Eve meal (catering) great!!

Will is amazing! I got off really late at night and came through hungry. Even though it was past closing he still went out of his way and he hooked me up with a delicious meal.  Thanks for making my night!

What an awesome little, unexpected food joint! I stumbled upon this place on Yelp, asked a friend to join, and loved the whole experience. We came for a late dinner (they're opened until midnight). It wasn't too busy, but there are only a few tables so we did wait a few minutes to find a seat. We ordered at the counter and the girl working was super helpful and welcoming.

name: PAI Honolulu
reviews: A beautiful place to go on a very special occasion or if your a foodie like me. We did the chef's seasonal 10 course meal. Yes pricey but worth it. Chef Kevin Lee is doing something amazing here and making Hawaii's local ingredients known to everyone. His team know what they are doing. The wine pairing was on point just have to go to experience it yourself. Salmon was cooked to perfection just🔥🔥🔥
Great upscale fusion cuisine. The Naw maw gai was so tender and juicy. Lots of interesting flavor combinations.

Absolutely incredible dining experience. Expertly crafted entree items and amazing specialty cocktails! The timing was slightly off between courses and leaves something to be desired from a few service aspect. Otherwise, incredible time.

Service was excellent, food was also great. My only complaint was my main, the fennel fish sausage pasta, was overly salty. I love salty foods, but this was inedibly salty. I was a guest at dinner and didn't want to make a scene so did not bring it up, but I'm sure the staff would have handled it very well.

I also saw that there was outdoor seating which was very pet friendly and staff supplied the dogs with water bowls and treats!! Bonus points!!

Visited Pai Honolulu for Restaurant Week (RW). Its located inside the Harbor Court building on Nimitz Blvd. It's on the smaller size of restaurants but simply inviting. Aesthetics very clean, modern and borderline industrial. We were seated at the bar side and the place holders were locally sourced so that in itself is a plus. We were offered the restaurant week menu as well as the house menu. We opted for restaurant week and glad for it. The RW menu included two options for each course, a 3-course menu (see picture). The pictures say it all and likely does not do it justice. Each dish was well thought out, paired well with wine options and delectable but very filling.  My favorite was the NZ green-lipped mussel as well as the chocolate brownie. Well done, Pai Honolulu! We will need to come again to try your regular menu!

name: Nico's Pier 38
address: 1129 N Nimitz Hwy, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Nico’s is a staple for fresh Hawaiian seafood. The atmosphere is the best because it is a bit outside the bustling city. The swordfish with mash potatoes is very tasty. Their beer menu is a bit on the smaller side. Nonetheless, my wife and I eat here every few months. Great place for dinner and lunch!

Counter service restaurant. Big enough place to find a seat even if it's busy. Food comes out quick and is pretty darn good. The little fish shop they have attached here is also great with some ready made tasty pieces of seasoned fish to take away. If you're in the area and need a quick lunch, I definitely recommend this place. 

They also have an upstairs restaurant for dinner with a different menu though I haven't tried it yet. I can only imagine that it is the same or better quality than it's downstairs counterpart.

Ok so this place has been on my list to try for a long time and boy was it worth it! The food is amazing! Incredibly fresh! The fish and chips were fantastic! The fish was flavorful and tasted like actual fish instead of that frozen taste you sometimes get at other places. The mayo based dipping sauce that came with it had so much fresh flavor and was a wonderful compliment for the fish. Another time i had the fish burger and this was probably the best fish burger i have ever had. Every element of that fish burger was well seasoned and tasty! The open air atmosphere with the central bar is so great and full of energy.  There is often live music here which just adds to the great relaxed feel. Even though the place was busy, the food came out so fast! This place is worth the hype and excitement.

Don’t bother with their Sunday brunch - zero effort to make a very limited spread delicious or even remotely appealing. We showed up at 1pm & the food looked like it had been there 2-3-4hrs. 6 or so slices of prime rib & 3-4 crab legs awaited customers. Military ID holders should head to KBay - limitless champagne & PILES of crab legs. Niko’s should send a team to observe & take notes - or don’t bother in the first place!

My friend took me for birthday drinks and the bartenders really took care of us. They were very attentive and made good drinks.  We were lucky to be there during Happy hour when drinks are only$5 or $6. We ordered truffle fries which were delicious.  We also shared the salted caramel cake which we thought was cheesecake at 1st, but it's a layered sponge cake.

name: MME Saigon Inc.
address: 900 Fort Street Mall, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews: Food is great.  Friendly service. Really good authentic Vietnamese food.  This is the lemongrass chicken sandwich.  It has a lot of pickled veggies and good amount of meat.  I usually get my lunch from here.
This is my go to for yummy vietnamese cuisine in downtown honolulu!  Lemon grass tofu on a salad or on papaya salad is delicious!
Great food and great customer service! They were so nice and accommodating. There were good veggie and meat options to choose from. Will be back!
Great flavors, good prices, lots of options
I love their tofu!

name: Moku Kitchen
address: 660 Ala Moana Blvd, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews: Great restaurant. Food is delicious, chef is on point! Duck Tacos were fire! Pizza was crispy and delicious, chicken wings were great. Truffle fries with dipping sauce was nice. We tried just about every cocktail and they were all unique and thoughtfully crafted. Our server Jenny was fantastic. Highly recommended.

The restaurant was great and has a great location. Food was great, portions were smaller than most but will get the job done. Nice scene to be in especially for nightlife. Staff was great. For me personally I just don't believe the food is worth the price. It's not overly expensive. Just overrated in my opinion.

Absolutley love this place. Good atmosphere. Extremely cordial helpful and chill staff. The happy hour is one of the best around. 
Another plus, there was live music during part of their service, and props to the sound design of the space! Not just a guy with his monitor speakers blasting from the corner, the sound was actually piped through their well placed and balanced house speaker system. BIG props for that!

We have eaten here twice on this trip! Both times amazing! The food and flavors are top notch! I docked one star because the second time we went there were a few things that came out wrong, which would have been no big deal but our waitress didnt even apologize for it and seemed bothered to fix it. Happy hour is also amazing deals, I would go out of my way for that!

Happy hour is great here. Overall a wide selection of food and beverages to satisfy everyone. Staff is always very nice and the place is kid friendly. Outside seating is less noisy if you want to hear the person next to you. Butternut squash raviolis and the pizzas are great for sharing.

name: Mexico Restaurant
address: 1247 N School St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews: Good Mexican, not great. There is an amazing Mexican place in Kaneohe that I was constantly comparing this place to so I was a little disappointed. However, the atmosphere is so much fun. It’s very authentic, had live music, the staff was friendly and the service was fairly quick. There is complimentary chips and salsa, and there is a wide variety of options. I would like to go back and try something else. I had the tostada salad and my husband had the California burrito. Their pork is very flavorful and delicious. That was my favorite thing I tried. Prices are reasonable and portions are huge!

Great experience! My husband and I had an 8 hour layover in Oahu so we rented a car to explore Honolulu. This restaurant was fabulous! I loved the atmosphere, the décor was super cute. Our service was very courteous and recommended some great drinks! The food was delicious, would highly recommend to anyone needing a quick bite craving home style Mexican food!

Not as good as I remember it from last year. The first few sips of the mango margarita were good, nice stiff pour....until I spotted a small ant in the glass. The drink was replaced with apologies and without question. In a tropical climate insects do happen.
In my opinion, the salsa left a lot to be desired. It is probably made in house, but tasted more like store bought; thick and no cilantro.

Always have enjoyed the good food here. Now I have discovered the Hawaiian-Mexican fusion kalua pork crispy tacos with roasted pineapple I have a new obsession. And staff is always friendly and accommodating. Thanks!

I came on “Taco Tuesday” for the $2.50 deal but decided against after discovering they’re real small corn tortillas with just meat and no toppings. Since my date already received his drink (which he didn’t like) I decided to order the Tostada Ranchero and boy was I pleasantly surprised when a large plate filled to the brim showed up. The food taste as good as it look. My date ordered the beef fajita and his order looked just as good. 

Overall if you want delicious food I recommend this place but maybe get your drink at a bar or don’t order the fancier margarita.

name: Heavenly Island Lifestyle
reviews: We have eaten here each of the last few times we have visited Waikiki. There is almost always a lineup down the steps which doesn't seems to move that fast but the wait is worth it. The staff were friendly and the food was fantastic, fresh and reasonably priced. We have never tried but I don't believe you can make reservations. We will keep coming back!

Heavenly was recommend to us by some friends. It turns out they have good taste! Excellent French toast with fresh fruit. I would say portion sizes might be a touch small for the price. Then again, who wants/needs left overs from breakfast.

Heavenly Island Lifestyle is a bustling but great restaurant to dine at. 

The waiters and staff were very enthusiastic and always had a smile on their face. 

The Big Island Ginger Pork Saute was very tender but should come with something to balance it out more. It's a bit salty with only the pork. The dish could come with more lettuce and tomato or something else. But pork tastes very authentic! I also think the prices are too high for the amount of food they serve. For example, the dish I mentioned above was $25.

One of the pasta dishes I thought didn't have much food on the plate. It was a gigantic plate with a blob of pasta in the middle. On the contrary, the sauce of the pasta tasted organic and the presentation of not only this item, but all of their dishes are spectacular. They really take the time to prepare everything nicely.

The outdoor seating is enjoyable and uncrowded. Sometimes there is a wait but it isn't too long. The staff told us 20 minutes but we got seated in no time.

The next door hotel where the bathrooms are has a nice seating area and has a really cool setting (see picture).

Overall, I would recommend this restaurant to whoever's reading this!

Delicious breakfast, there was a good variety of things from eggs Benedict  french toast, to ginger chicken Pho.  The service was good.  The restaurant is not that big but there is some outdoor seating. The ingredients are all local, sourced from the islands, so very fresh.

Locally sourced ingredients cooked to deliciousness! We got the pork belly egg benny and the purple yam was a nice yummy surprise it was so good. Ambience is great and attracts birds coming in to visit, just remember not to feed them!

name: Herringbone Waikiki
reviews: Sunday brunch. Bottomless mimosas. Great food and relaxed open atmosphere. it's a little iffy when it's rainy, but if you sit in the middle section or inside it's fine. Prices are a little high, but to be expected in Waikiki. I really miss Ray Ray's pancakes from the menu!

This is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten. My husband and I went during happy hour and ordered most of the apps on the menu. While everything was outstanding, if we had to choose a favorite it would be the brussel sprouts! I was ready to order a second round!!!

This might be the best happy hour I've been to. Drinks were great, I had the Manhattan but they all got good reviews. Oysters are only $2 and they aren't the Pacifics I think it changes every day. The winner though,as weird as it sounds, is the buffalo octopus. By far the most well prepared octopus I've ever had. It sounds weird in the menu but I'd give it a shot.

This place is on the 3rd floor of the outdoor portion of the mall. Google maps will mislead you and put you on the Macys side if the mall, but you want the opposite side.
The restaurant is in a quieter portion of the mall where one can hear the music downstairs,  but its muted enough to enjoy conversation. We started in the front patio area that had a high ceiling and was divided from.the mall by hanging platters and crab traps, so it was both airy and private. Service was efficient yet very pleasant and personable.  We had the Skiff seafood platter, plus two cocktails: Better Mules and Gardens and (I think) the Smokey Mistress. Both were sizable and well-constructed. Delicious.  The platter included oysters, crab, lobster and shrimp, all on a bed of ice along with 5 dipping sauces. All were perfectly prepared,  and the shrimp were a standout - we ordered a few more of those. So fresh and sweet.

I’m oyster crazy so this is my happy hour heaven (4-6, 9pm-closing). Ask for the best ones they have ( seasonal). We got the Japanese oyster which I can’t recall the name. It’s one of the best I’ve ever had in the US. Similar taste to agate oyster I’ve had in Hog Island in San Fran.

name: Stage Restaurant
reviews: An awesome experience. The ambiance is trendy and romantic. The staff is very knowledgeable about their food, welcoming, and responsive. The food is delicious. There is a good variety. It's a fusion of various cultures, you can have a Beef Wellington, pork belly, or fish.

First the good -  The food was excellent; the duck breast was perfectly prepared with delicious sides, their version of Caesar salad did not consist of romaine covered in dressing, but instead included endive and hearts of palm with just enough dressing.  Superb service, attentive but unintrusive servers, who were knowledgeable about the menu.  Stimulating art filled environment.  The not so good - we sat in what can be described as a booth, with wooden bench seats with pillows that proved to be uncomfortable as the dinner went on.  The tables was a little too high as well.  If you go, you might want to sit at a table with more conventional straight back chairs.

Great food. Well worth the money. Only reason I couldn't give it 5 stars was the seating and set up of the tables. They have these weird low benches paired with tables that are far too high up. Not comfortable. Nearly every table is set up this way. Otherwise food and service were great.
Great restaurant! The food was delicious and the staff was friendly. Very nice atmosphere and great selection of wines and drinks. Live music was also nice. You have to visit this place.
We had a wonderful evening with a fantastic culinary experience. This is fine cuisine on a top-level.

name: Tonkatsu Ginza Bairin
reviews: Wow, this place is amazing! Great food and great service. The rice and side dishes are refillable as well!
Usually I had this dish with beef, but the pork was also tasty. The sauces were a bit different than those used in Japan but again, still tasty. Their soup was amazing

Satisfy your cravings with some perfectly fried pork or shrimp.  Not a drop of grease and perfectly crispy on the outside.  For a reasonable price you get the main course which also comes with sticky rice, soup and a salad.  Super deal in Waikiki.  Staff are very friendly even if you ask for a spoon for your soup and a fork.

First place we stopped to eat on our first trip to Hawaii! By far the best restaurant we’ve visited on our trip. A little expensive but worth it for the great food! Very nice customer service as well. Cute atmosphere.

Absolutely wonderful meal. Our server was super helpful, and incredibly polite. Took his suggestion on a couple of our food choices, and I'm really glad we did. The crab cream cheese puffs were fried to perfection, and the pork katsu don was the best I'd ever had.
Overall great experience with amazing food and service.

name: Vino Italian Tapas & Wine Bar
address: 500 Ala Moana Blvd #6f, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
reviews: Awesome dining experience. Had dinner with my family their tonight and everything was fabulous.  From the marrow appetizers to our entrees, all was phenomenal. Chuck and his team always make your time their enjoyable and memorable. This is a "must" experience whether you are a local or just visiting. Guaranteed you'll have a great time.
What a great atmosphere and even better service! The food is exceptional yet very comforting. All the patrons look like they thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience...as we did!

Excellent food and service.  Experiencing different regional wines from europe is on another level of its own.  The staff is very attentive and easy to speak to.  They really make you feel comfortable and go out of their way to explain everything and make sure you are okay with everything.

Everything is fabulous here. I highly recommend to try the warm Apple tart paired with their Moscato. The bone marrow was amazing! Especially with the Osso Buco underneath. I also like the gnocchi because you can tell it's homemade
Not a wine drinker but the food was amazing here. Definitely will return.  Service was good. Atmosphere was good.

name: Hoku's
reviews: Hoku's at The Kahala Hotel & Resort is one of my favorite restaurants in Honolulu. The "Global Hawaiian Cuisine" is one of the best on Oahu and a fantastic dining experience. Chef Eric Oto combines tradition and innovation in a perfect manner. The atmosphere and view are fantastic.

We ate here on Valentine’s Day 2019!. Food was delicious. We all got the tasting menu with the wine paring. Super pricey but the food was worth it. The staff were all very nice and the bathrooms were clean.

Love the food, tried the fried prawns & fish, it was super delicious.

The Garlic rice was finger looking good.

In starter they provide "Rice Crackers" which is toooooo yummy. I asked them to refill it😂 as I finished the first batch too quick.

Also tried the dessert (forgot the name). It was good too.

The staff is very good. Ambience and cleanliness is 10/10. Highly recommended.

What an incredible experience! My husband and I celebrated our honeymoon at the Kahala Resort and made reservations at Hoku's. I couldn't recommend them more! From the moment we stepped through the doors, staff treated us with respect and warmth. Our server, Chris, was incredibly attentive and positive and the food was the stuff of dreams. Hands down, the best dining experience of my life. Thank you so much to Chris and everyone else at Hoku's for making our meal such an unforgettable adventure.

P.S. - the lamb is to die for.

Wonderful, elegant food that was perfectly cooked with wonderful and unique flavors. The service was wonderful, the view was amazing, and I highly recommend checking out this restaurant within the amazing Kahala Hotel. I personally recommend the ahi sashimi and the duck.

name: Char Hung Sut Restaurant
address: 64 N Pauahi St, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews:
Awesome Freshness Made to order every morning!
Dim Sum items & Noodles are both just right & Yummy!!

I went for the Manapua and I was not disappointed. 40 years ago it cost $0.25 for one from the food truck that frequented our school. Today it cost $1.90: a bargain compared to the real estate cost increases in Hawaii over the past 40 years.

Their hours are limited and Char Hung Sut is not a restaurant.  They have a very limited number of options, but they do have soda in a cooler if you need something to drink. Your food is placed in a cardboard box and tied shut - everything is carry out.  

Their operation is very basic, fun to watch, and efficient. They take your order, get your food, take your money and you are expected to move on so someone else can get their food.

Parking is street parking, and because you’re in Chinatown you might want to take the time to explore a bit while you’re there.

The manapua is great, and I expect the rest of what they do is very good as well. I hope I have the time, and appetite given all the other great food options in the area.

Small shop that makes everything right in front of you! Though there are only a handful of things in the menu, you should just get the pork buns. Extremely fluffy, sweet & savory - exactly how a pork bun should taste. Pork hash was good (texture similar to sticky rice dumplings) but didn't care for the half moon & pepitao.

Overall, the portions of the fillings were a bit smaller than expected. Especially in the pork bun, there was much more bread than filling.
Although there is no space to eat in, you are sure to get good manapua here! They open at 5:30am. Go early if you would like to get some. Don't forget to try black sugar manapua as well.
Delicious manapuas and dim sum

name: Town
address: 3435 Waialae Ave Conference Room, Honolulu, HI 96816, USA
reviews:
My husband and I had a good meal here. Very nice friendly service. Food was tasty and fresh. A relaxed atmosphere with a skateboarding/surfer vibe. A little pricey but it's nice to know you are eating farm to table.

Pasta was delicious.

I liked that they reused old menus for coasters.
Definitely one of the best restaurants in Honolulu. Amazing food and so much is locally sourced.

Great food every time. Always something interesting and delicious. Beer selection is small but of high quality. Everything is locally sourced with a fresh menu each night. For me, it's a must-visit every time I come to Honolulu.

Ate a la carte and all dishes were delicious. I would give them five stars for the food if they heated the plates (and bought a salamander for the pick-up counter). Two of our dishes were lukewarm at best. The neighbouring table had the same issue, so this may be systemic. And the toilets are atrocious.

Town is a fantastic neighborhood restaurant trying to punch above its weight as a Honolulu ‘destination’ establishment. By that measure, they’ve got a ways to go ... But first, the food - fresh, local and well-presented - everything was good but not “I can’t wait to have that again” spectacular or unique. Decor-wise, it is a relatively small and busy space that can get loud. So don’t expect intimate conversation or to find a romantic nook. Finally, on the night we dined the service was friendly but oddly timed and noticeably slow at times to the point our server thanked us for our patience. My guess is that a new kitchen staff was being trained. Regardless, I’d expected better given the restaurant’s street cred and price point. Bottom line: a good but not exceptional meal priced in a competitive market that offers plenty of alternatives worthy of consideration.

name: O'Kims
reviews:
If you want to know about the fresh great Korean food, this is the place. I love their food. Great price, clean, fast nice service. 

I had my friend baby birthday party with 10 people in the back yard. She put us own tables and private time. 

big size foods and OYOB. 

It was only cost $ 200 for whole things. and She was keep giving us something new, hot, delicious food. 

Try it. you will like it.
The fresh dishes are mouthwatering and the execution is fantastic! 🤤 You won't be disappointed. I go weekly now.
This place is wonderful. Food is consistently good and fresh. Portions are very generous. The ambiance was cool, big food portions. Price was right. Can't wait to go back.
Best pork belly I've ever had the pleasure of tasting! Everything tasted so fresh and delicious.
Good food and cozy vibe. Purple rice was really tasty - included in all dishes. Pork belly was tender, came with a side of salad which was refreshing. Would recommend

name: Maguro Brothers
reviews:
This is my second time here. My first time was 4 years ago. They have more choices now. The quality is top notch!!!!
Must try the Miso Hamachi Grilled!!!! So ONO!!!
EVERYTHING in this small corner store is delicious and fresh! Also very affordable not marked up at all.
They have very few sittings. 
I will come back again when I get a chance.

Fabulous fish. Fresh and seasoned beautifully. Can never go wrong with Maguro Brothers. It's not the greatest atmosphere, the shop is tucked inside an Asian grocery in Kekaulike market. But the food is worth it. There are small tables with some seating but not for large groups. Staff work this location and the one o Nahua street.  Poke is served a bit more Japanese style so less saucy, allowing you to really taste the freshness of the fish. A must in Honolulu.
Fresh seafood.  Very tasty and authentic Japanese style food.  Odd location in the middle of a Chinatown market place.  Worth finding.
This is the best poke place in Chinatown, hands down. Nice people, open 10-3, fantastic and with some superior grilled items.

FRESH FISH! So delicious fresh fish. The Spicy Ahi and Hamachi was so incredibly fresh and melted in my mouth. The sauce used is also very tasty. The prices are perfectly moderate. I'd say you're getting more quality than what you pay but that's subjective. $10-$15, depending on what you get. SO GOOD!

name: Basalt
reviews: Stopped by for brunch with family. They have outdoor and indoor seating areas. This place is super cute. Upon entry, everyone was so friendly. It's like a market/ restaurant combo. If you're just visiting,  I'm sure you'd find gifts for whomever. Now the for the food. The food was visually pleasing,  fresh, and delicious. The fruit was perfectly sweet and crisp in all the right places. My sister got the Fresh Salmon Bagel but I was too slow on taking the photo. I cant say enough about the potatoes that I stole from the plates of others in my party. 😁 Definitely a spot I'll return to.

Was recommended by Guy from Hawaii News and his Cheap Eats segment. Highly recommend to visit during happy hour. Cheap eats it is! We got the charcoal bun pork belly and their vegetarian pizza. Both had fresh ingredients and always excited for the next bite.

Fine dining in a market setting. Great bartenders, I sat at the bar and they were responsive and professional. My meal highlights were the fresh salad with watermelon radish and the main course, hawaiian shrimp with charcoal linguine. I was a little perplexed by the use of so much charcoal in the food, like the rolls which are black, my linguine, and then apparently they serve charcoal pancakes as well. I haven't seen much in the way of research regarding the health benefits, so I think it goes with the geologic-Hawaii theme alluded to in the name, Basalt.

Had breakfast here as they were one of the few places opened at 7am and we were jet lagged. Service was great, enjoyed the outdoor seating. Food was okay. Ordered the loco moco and while tasty, I was told not authentic. Also had the charcoal pancakes as advertised by everyone. The kids and hubby gobbled it right up and didn’t even leave me a bite so I’ll take that as a good sign.

First time eating their food. And it was take out.

The curbside pick up was Perfect timing, 15% off and our Wagyu patty fried rice Loco Moco  and prime rib melt were excellent.

We will do the take out again! We hope to keep Hawaii cooking and to see the local business survive during this difficult time. 

Charcoal pancakes are to be tried out for sure!

name: Duc's Bistro
reviews: What can I say but perfect!!!  French food is my favorite and this place takes the Cake with the finest food ever .. each dish and course I had was like a orgasm to my tease buds .. if your a foodies person like me?? This is a must eat please Thank you guys yummy

Duck's Bistro is a quaint little restaurant in China town that serves the most delicious dishes.   The service is awesome and they make you feel at home.   Everything was amazing as you can see we couldn't wait to try the escargots.  I would highly recommend this place.

Please do not pass through Honolulu without having dinner at this restaurant! We ate family style so we could all sample broadly. There was not a single disappointment! The rack of lamb melted in my mouth! The pan fried Basso fish was delicate and flavorful. The fire roasted eggplant was exotically seasoned. The iced coffee, cheese cake, and tapioca were fabulous! This place is a must!
Food was great service excellent. A little warm.

This is a stellar find - one of those "best kept secret" places. Just a small,  wonderful French Vietnamese restaurant with subtle, flavorful dishes that can surprise you in the best way. Every dish was something special. Leave room for the amazing desserts.

name: Rangoon Burmese kitchen
reviews: This is a very unique Restaurant.  The food IS REALLY GOOD.  The taste is like a blend of different Asian cuisines. Hard to put into words,  put your tastebuds & stomach will love it.

We've been here a couple of times, very good. We had the Rangoon Tea Leaf Salad, Mashed Potato Salad and the Garlic Noodle with tofu. The atmosphere is very chill and the staff is kind and knowledgeable. We will definitely be going back again.... and again. See you there! Aloha

Delicious Tea Leaf Salad, best on the island. The chicken and pork curries have a fish sauce flavor that makes it unlike any other curry, in a good way. The Samusas are great too. Parking is not bad in the evening. You can find free street parking easily in downtown, or use one of the many paid lots.

I got the Burmese curry with lamb. It was so flavorful and delicious! It was also a ton of food - I hadn't eaten until I went here for lunch, and I still couldn't finish all the food. I got a side of rice, and also some of these flaky bread things to eat with the curry - I would recommend one or the other. (Note that both are an extra charge - the curry doesn't come with rice.)

The food is quite delicious. The flavors are layered and subtle. The Tea Leaf Salad offers rich textures. The Brussel Sprouts with Dried Fish appetizer was probably my favorite choice that day, although the Burmese Fish Curry was also a standout. What most impressed our party was the fact that we arrived 20 minutes before the 2:00 closing of lunch hours, yet the service was excellent and we were not rushed by the staff. Atmosphere is vogue and comfortable, welcoming to professionals on lunch break, families, locals and visitors alike.

name: Tango Contemporary Cafe
address: 1288 Ala Moana Blvd #120, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews:
The food was decidedly mediocre.  Even if the food was half the price I wouldn't go back.  It had nothing that was alluring, or memorable.

The presentation of the food was good, but that left me with a deep sense of dissatisfaction as I was expecting more.  I'm not sure why this place gets good reviews.  There are numerous places that are better at the same price point or cheaper (which is sad).  Maybe, the chefs were having an off night.

The service was decent.

Edit: I just realized that most of the reviews are for breakfast/brunch.  It's possible that the breakfast is better than the dinner menu.

Edit:  Went to Fete in Chinatown next week.  Cafe Tango is trash.  The second worst restaurant I've been to on Oahu.  Do not go here if you like good food.

It is very popular place for breakfast and lunch. 
(They are great for dinner too)

Casual but I always feel that the food is prepared with intention to make good so everyone can enjoy eating.  Heart is in! .. so to say, in short 

I like the grass fed meat burger here.  Simple but fresh ingredients. 

Friends enjoyed their shrimp risotto and vegetarian sandwich as well.

If you are in the neighborhood I highly recommend trying this place.  It’s tucked away but just across the street from the TJ Max/south shore place.

Wednesday at 2:15pm
They deserve the 5 stars. Service and food was more than a four star. Cool find near shopping and downtown. I will bring my guests here this month. Nice find! Very fresh ingredients.

Attended an awesome fundraising event a few years back and forgot to upload the pics.  Food was awesomely original and tasty.  Their staff was incredibly professional and friendly.  Cozy place for a romantic dinner or a BFF celebration...

A true gem in Honolulu. Food never disappoints here! Portions are not huge but they are filling. You cannot go wrong with whatever you choose. Their desserts are delish, so leave room for something! 

Parking is validated or park nearby and walk over. I haven't had to wait but if you ever need to, there are tons of shops around to browse while you wait.

name: Buca di Beppo Italian Restaurant
address: 1030 Auahi St Bay 1, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews: We had a  enjoyable lunch and took in a movie later. The background music (60s rock 'n roll)  had a lot to be desired which also clashed with TV in the bar. Nice soft Italian music would have been much better. Server was friendly and pleasant.

Good food and an interesting decor. Only issue was their pricing. Charged by the number of guests on your table. I explained to our server I wouldn't be having any of the shrimp pasta dish because of an allergy. Still charged although I carefully explained the situation. So, while it is good food be aware even if you can't eat the food for whatever reason you're going to be chargedif others on the table order the dish.

Not sure if this was an anomaly but the food was not good at all. The fettuccine Alfredo was so plain and flavorless I had to add salt to it. The fried mozzarella looked like it had been refried to keep it hot. Grocery store bread is better than the complimentary bread they serve. The spinach artichoke dip was decent at best. The only good thing we had was the fried macaroni. I see why this would be a good option for parties of 4+ but for less it’s a complete waste of food and money. You could go to a fine dining establishment and be satisfied with the amount you pay for two people at Buca. (Around 75$)
Large portion family style Italian food! Bar area has lunch menu for solo dining but portion is still large. Spicy chicken rigatoni was delicious with a kick!

I would say the happiest and best experience and affordable each time we celebrate birthdays for my immediate and extended family from all over the world.  And best of all, the employees amazingly gathers together with candles to sing the BUCA birthday song to top off the celebration.

name: Plumeria Beach House
reviews: Mostly went for drinks, but we hit up the seafood buffet one night. Very, very good. I was humming with excitement every time I went back up to get more. The drinks at the bar are expensive, but the staff are very nice and professional. The views and decor are top notch. Keep in mind $$$$ and you will very much enjoy this place.

Better than expected based on what friends and family had said! Not cheap, but you're paying for the exclusive location. I went for dinner. I liked the cheese platter and the New York steak. Get the mashed potatoes. It's four stars because the breakfast buffet is super crowded and the line for omelets is almost always a long wait.
Lovely place for a wedding reception! Buffet was fabulous! Servers were attentive & full of the Aloha spirit!!!
Food was delicious.. view's are awesome. Service was excellent.

We sat at the Bar with Bobby and Steve waiting on us. It was the most pleasant time with the cool breeze and great conversation.  Next time we should take in the buffet.  Looks great!! They took great care of us.

name: Tikis Grill & Bar
reviews: Good food and ridiculously large portion sizes for a reasonable price. Can you find more complex flavors with a delicate touch? Sure! Sometimes you just want a good meal without sticker shock. Go during happy hour and get a $6 cocktail!

I am a huge fan of tiki-bars. This one is excellent. Found it while staying at the hotel it is in. At first, drink prices look a tiny bit expensive. But, then you see you get really nice souvenir glasses INCLUDED. Worked our way through the drink menu AND had gifts for people back home. These are made locally (not Chinese factory items). Only had appetizers but enjoyed them. There is also a full food menu. The restaurant is very nice with a huge patio area overlooking the water (and sunset). Add the nightly live-music... we came back a lot. And the views of the sunset are incredible!

Fun place with a great atmosphere!   We came off the beach and hit happy hour here, it was so good we ended up coming back for dinner later!   They’ve got some really neat glasses you can get with some of their drinks, they give you a new, boxed one to take home with you!!

One of the nicest meals my wife and I have had in a while. Started with watermelon/feta salad which was such a beautiful combination of tastes. I had the Hawaiian fish which was absolutely delicious. We finished up with the macadamia nut pie which was scrumptious. Service was great, sunset view was gorgeous.
Only downside was the lack of main course vegetarian options.

Oh my! Yum! The food and service was amazing! Our server was awesome! We notice how crowded the place was in each passing And decided to stop in. It did not disappoint. Located on the main strip of Waikiki across from the beach!

name: Nobu Honolulu
address: 1118 Ala Moana Blvd # 100, Honolulu, HI 96814, USA
reviews: This was excellent and super classy. The food was unusual and delicious, especially the black cod hot appetizer. Our waiter and the wait staff was responsive and happy to explain the unusual Japanese dishes. He set us up with course after course of delicious appetizers and sushi rolls. It was expensive but well worth it. The whole experience was terrific and we left super satisfied, I tipped 40% I was so pleased with everything. I've done that once before (see my review on House Without a Key) and I hope to return to Hawaii someday just to eat in these two places.

What an amazing experience! The food was incredible and what was even more incredible was our waiter Marcus. He took the time to explain every dish and the flavours of each one. He put together a great tasting menu for us which we enjoyed immensely. Thank you so much for a great evening and experience. We will be back again for sure and highly recommend this place.

They need more options for vegetarians (who also don't eat seafood) besides tofu. I only had the shishito peppers & dessert, which was very good. My boyfriend got a steak dinner which looked really good!
Really enjoyed an amazing dinner here. Each dish was more delicious than the last. The cocktails were excellent and dessert was the tasty cherry on top of it all!
We have been visiting Nubu for years now, and it is definitely the most consistent restaurant in Honolulu. Their Sake Old Fashioned are a must, and feature a clear, hand carved ice cube. Ridiculous!

name: Taormina Sicilian Cuisine
reviews: Get the lasagna! The Spaghetti Vongole was also really delicious. Our server was very knowledgeable and helped us pick delicious dishes that met our individual taste preferences. Wonderful dining experience. The entire staff was attentive and friendly. Great service. Great food. All you need to bring is great company.
My husband and I had dinner here during one of our nights in Oahu. I had the truffle carbonara and we shared the tour of Italy. Both were delicious and the service was great!
Best vegan pasta I’ve had in a while. Superb service. Thanks Jacko for your detailed attention

Food was amazing!! Their customer service was great. My brother's meal wasn't ready at the same time as ours so they gave him a little mini meal to eat while waiting. Highly recommend to get the carbonara

Very polite. Came in with a party of 5 last minute. Didnt expect to be helped right away, servers, host, and manager were awesome. Thank you so much for making our family dinner so wonderful. Food was excellent, service amazing, couldn't be happier.

name: Teishoku Restaurant
address: 1620 N School St C, Honolulu, HI 96817, USA
reviews:
Craig K.

The food is delicious. The staff are friendly. We always order the two choices. During dinner we try a little bit of each other's food. Huge portions. I will be going back.

Amazing food and super friendly customer service. I love the green tea they keep giving you. I ordered the tempura shrimp and oysters that come with miso soup and rice. Delicious! I was not expecting this restaurant to be so good because the location is not great.
I call this place my Little secret hole in the wall?? Great food great prices yummy yummy yummy Asian cuisine. So good can't wait to eat here again

We stoppes by here twice while we were on our honeymoon. Both times the food was absolutely amazing. And I say this after having gone to a menagerie of restaurants here and in many places around the US that specialize in similar cuisines. The prices are great too. When we come back we will definitely come here to eat again.

Debbie K.

Teshoku Resturant is beautiful inside. Nice paintings displayed on the wall. Clean dining area. Cool and comfortable. Customers can enjoy nice relaxing lunch or dinner. Friendly staff. Jason is friendly and kind. The food is delicious. Huge portions too. Fast service. Plenty of parking. I will definitely be going back. I highly recommend Teishoku Restaurant. Give Teishoku Restaurant a try your tummy will be happy you did. 😊

I went back this morning Valentine's Day. My order was for two two choices. I waited extra long time. Another lady was waiting too. The lady brings out an order and just leaves it and walks away. The lady tells me she no tell who's order that leave the order walk away. She went behind the counter looked and said that's my order took it and walked out upset. Me still waiting asked how long more for my order. She tells me they had a lot of take out orders. What upset me is everyone dining in was getting their order fast while I wait. Finally my order ready after an extra long wait. 

I don't think I will be going back. I have better things to do than wasting my time waiting.

name: Do-ne
reviews: This place is really small with about 8 tables but the food is good! There is parking behind and the waiting is short. Try the seafood set. I loved it!
Great homemade food with quality presentation and nice service, space are limited so be prepare for a bit of wait
So fantastic. Tiny little restaurant.. about 6 tables, but the food is wonderful and very authentic Japanese. It's BYOB so come prepared.

Traditional japanese sets and ala Carte. Very good. Not huge portions but not small and pretentious. Very happy with this place. Maybe seats 24-30 at tops. Reccomend reserving or going after 8. Great food. Really for the price I couldn't have been happier.

An amazing little gem of a hole-in-the-wall type place. Authentic Japanese teshoku; the staff here were so friendly and the food was amazing. Made with tender love and care and offered at an excellent value point. Would visit here everyday if I could have =)! Highly recommend if you're in the area. There are only a few tables inside and a couple chairs to wait at outside. Their opening hours are limited, but definitely worth it. Staff are Japanese and so humble and genuine.
